translations.text: When he withdrew from them, and from what they worship besides God, We granted him Isaac and Jacob. And each We made a prophet.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thereupon Abraham dissociated himself from his people and the deities they worshipped instead of Allah, and We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob and made each of them a Prophet;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So when he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides Allah, We gave him Ishaq and Ya`qub, and each one of them We made a Prophet.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So, when he had withdrawn from them and that which they were worshipping beside Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob. Each of them We made a prophet.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when he had left them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each We made a prophet.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So when he turned away from them and those they worshipped, other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob. Each of them We made a Prophet,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When (Abraham) rejected his people and what they worshipped instead of God, We gave him Isaac and Jacob and made both of them Prophets.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So when he withdrew from them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We gave to him Ishaq and Yaqoub, and each one of them We made a prophet.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma iAAtazalahum wama yaAAbudoona min dooni Allahi wahabna lahu ishaqa wayaAAqooba wakullan jaAAalna nabiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So when he had separated himself from them and from what they worshipped besides God, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and We made each of them a prophet.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides Allah, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and each one of them We made a prophet.

verses.text: وَ وَهَبْنَا لَهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ رَحْمَتِنَا وَ جَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ‌ لِسَانَ‌ صِدْقٍ‌ عَلِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به آنان از رحمت خود بخشیدیم، وبرای آنان [در میان مردم] نامی نیک و ستایشی والامرتبه قرار دادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و رحمت خويش را به آنها ارزانى داشتيم و سخن نيكو و آوازه بلند داديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آنها را از رحمت خويش بهره‌مند ساختيم، و نام نيك و بلندى [در ميان امت‌ها] برايشان قرار داديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از رحمت خويش به آنان ارزانى داشتيم، و ذكر خيرِ بلندى برايشان قرار داديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آنها را از رحمت خود بهره‌مند ساختیم و بر زبان عالمی آوازه نکونامی‌شان را بلند گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و رحمت خویش را شامل ایشان کردیم (و در پرتو آن به خیر و خوبی دنیا و آخرت رسیدند) و آنان را نیکونام و بلندآوازه کردیم. [[«مِن رَّحْمَتِنَا»: رحمت خود را. برخی از رحمت خود را. در پرتو رحمت خود خیر و خوبی دنیا و آخرت را بهره ایشان کردیم. «لِسَانَ»: زبان. در اینجا مراد کلام و گفتار است. عربها گاهی اندام را بر چیزی اطلاق می‌کنند که از آن عضو صادر می‌شود. از قبیل: یَد، بر قدرت و عطاء (نگا: فتح / 10، ص / 45). قَدَم، بر فضل و برتری (نگا: یونس / 2). لِسَان، بر کلام (نگا: ابراهیم / 4). «لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ»: ذکر جمیل. نام نیکو. (صِدْقٍ) مصدر است و به هنگام اضافه واژه‌ای بدان، معنی وصفی دارد و بیانگر زیبائی و نیکوئی مضافِ خود است. از قبیل: رَجُلُ صِدْقٍ. إِمْرَأَةُ صِدْقٍ. قَدَمُ صِدْقٍ. مَقْعَدُ صِدْقٍ. لِسانُ صِدْقٍ. اضافه موصوف به صفتِ خود است (نگا: یونس / 2). «عَلِیّاً»: والا مقام. صفت (لِسانَ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به آنان از رحمت خویش بخشیدیم و برای آنان آوازه راستین و بلند پدید آوردیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از رحمت خود به آنان عطا کردیم؛ و برای آنها نام نیک و مقام برجسته‌ای (در میان همه امّتها) قرار دادیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بخشیدیم بدیشان از رحمت خود و نهادیم برای ایشان زبان راستیی فرازنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و از رحمت خويش به ايشان بخشيديم و براى آنان [در ميان مردم‌] نام نيكو و آوازه بلند نهاديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و برخی از رحمت خویش را به آنان بخشیدیم، و زبانی راستین (و) بلندمرتبه برایشان قرار دادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And bestowed on them some of Our blessings, and gave them high renown.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We gave them Our mercy, and assigned for them a true and high repute.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and We gave them of Our mercy, and We appointed unto them a tongue of truthfulness, sublime.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We bestowed on them of Our mercy, and We made for them a renown lofty.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We gave them of Our Mercy (a good provision in plenty), and We granted them honour on the tongues (of all the nations, i.e. everybody remembers them with a good praise).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We gave them freely of Our mercy, and gave them a noble reputation of truth.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We bestowed on them Our mercy, and granted them a truly lofty renown.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We gave them of Our mercy, and We granted them Sidqin `Aliyyan on the tongues.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And we gave them of Our mercy, and assigned to them a high and true renown.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And We gave them out of Our mercy, and conferred on them a worthy and lofty repute.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and We gave them of Our Mercy and We appointed to them a truthful, highly sincere tongue,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We granted them Our blessing and high renown.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We granted to them of Our mercy, and We left (behind them) a truthful mention of eminence for them.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wawahabna lahum min rahmatina wajaAAalna lahum lisana sidqin AAaliyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We granted them Our mercy and bestowed on them true and high renown.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them, and We granted them lofty honour on the tongue of truth.

verses.text: وَ اذْکُرْ فِي‌ الْکِتَابِ‌ مُوسَى‌ إِنَّهُ‌ کَانَ‌ مُخْلَصاً وَ کَانَ‌ رَسُولاً نَبِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در این کتاب، [سرگذشتِ] موسی را یاد کن، بی تردید او انسانی خالص شده و فرستاده ای پیامبر بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و در اين كتاب، موسى را ياد كن. او بنده‌اى مخلص و فرستاده‌اى پيامبر بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در اين كتاب از موسى ياد كن، همانا او خالص شده و فرستاده‌اى پيامبر بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در اين كتاب از موسى ياد كن، زيرا كه او پاكدل و فرستاده‌اى پيامبر بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و یاد کن در کتاب خود شرح حال موسی را که او بنده‌ای برگزیده و رسولی بزرگ و مبعوث به پیمبری بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در کتاب (آسمانی قرآن) سخن از موسی بگو. کسی که پاک و برگزیده‌ی خدا، و پیغمبری بس والا بود. [[«کَانَ»: بود. تکرار این واژه، برای تکریم و تفخیم شأن موسی است. «مُخْلَصاً»: کسی که خدا او را از نقائص زدوده و برای خویشتن برگزیده است (نگا: اعراف / 144). کسی که با تمام وجود از آن خدا و پالوده از شرک است (نگا: یوسف / 24). «نَبِیّاً»: والا مقام. رفیع. از مصدر (نُبُوَّة) به معنی رفعت. خبر دهنده. از (نَبَأ) به معنی خبر؛ یعنی کسی که از سوی خدا، یکتاپرستی و قوانین الهی را به اطّلاع مردم می‌رساند. در این صورت، ذکر دو وصف (رَسُولاً) و (نَبِیّاً) تنها جنبه تأکید و تعظیم دارد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در کتاب آسمانی از موسی یاد کن که او اخلاص یافته و فرستاده‌ای پیامبر بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در این کتاب (آسمانی) از موسی یاد کن، که او مخلص بود، و رسول و پیامبری والا مقام!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و یاد کن در کتاب موسی را که او است ناآلوده و بوده است پیمبری فرستاده شده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و در اين كتاب، موسى را ياد كن همانا او برگزيده و ويژه شده [خدا] بود و فرستاده‌اى پيامبر بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در کتاب، موسی را یاد کن (که) همواره او پاک‌شده‌ای (ربانی) و (نیز) فرستاده‌ای برجسته بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Commemorate Moses in the Book. He was a chosen one, both an apostle and a prophet.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And remember Moosa in the Book; he was indeed a chosen one, and he was a Noble Messenger, a Herald of the Hidden.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And mention in the Book Moses; he was devoted, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And mention thou in the Book Musa: verily he was single- hearted, and was an apostle, prophet.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And mention in the Book (this Quran) Musa (Moses). Verily! He was chosen and he was a Messenger (and) a Prophet.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And mention in the Scripture Moses. He was dedicated. He was a messenger and a prophet.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And recite in the Book the account of Moses. He was a chosen one, a Messenger, a Prophet.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And mention in the Book, Musa. Verily, he was Mukhlasan and he was a Messenger, (and) a Prophet.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And make mention in the Scripture of Moses. Lo! he was chosen, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And mention in the Book Moses. Indeed he was exclusively dedicated [to Allah], and an apostle and prophet.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Mention in the Book, Moses. He was devoted, a Messenger, and a Prophet.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), mention in the Book (the Quran) the story of Moses. Moses was a sincere person, a Messengers and a Prophet.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And mention Musa in the Book; surely he was one purified, and he was an apostle, a prophet.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waothkur fee alkitabi moosa innahu kana mukhlasan wakana rasoolan nabiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Tell also of Moses in the Book. He was indeed a chosen one, and was a messenger and a prophet.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.

verses.text: وَ نَادَيْنَاهُ‌ مِنْ‌ جَانِبِ‌ الطُّورِ الْأَيْمَنِ‌ وَ قَرَّبْنَاهُ‌ نَجِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و او را از جانب راست طور ندا کردیم، و او را در حالی که با وی راز گفتیم، مقرّب خود قرار دادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و او را از جانب راست كوه طور ندا داديم و نزديكش ساختيم تا با او راز گوييم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از جانب راست طور او را ندا داديم و رازگويان نزديكش ساختيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از جانب راست طور، او را ندا داديم، و در حالى كه با وى راز گفتيم او را به خود نزديك ساختيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما او را از جانب راست (وادی مقدس) طور ندا کردیم و به مقام قرب خود برای استماع کلام خویش برگزیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما او را از طرف راست کوه طور ندا در دادیم (و موسی از جانب راست خود ندای ما را شنید) و او را نزدیک کردیم و با او سخن گفتیم. [[«الأیْمَنِ»: طرف راست. مراد این است که نسبت به موسی، طرف راست بود والاّ کوه راست و چپ ندارد. صفت (جانِبِ) است (نگا: طه / 80). این واژه به معنی (مُبارَک) نیز آمده است. در این صورت می‌تواند صفت (جانِبِ) یا (الطُّورِ) باشد. «قَرَّبْنَاهُ نَجِیّاً»: مراد از نزدیک گرداندن، قرب و منزلت بخشیدن معنوی است، و (نَجِیّاً) فَعیل به معنی مُفاعِل، یعنی مُناجی است؛ همچون جَلیس به معنی مُجالِس، و نَدیم به معنی مُنادِم، و حال است (نگا: یوسف / 80).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او و او را از جانب طور ایمن ندا دادیم و او را به همرازی خود نزدیک گرداندیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما او را از طرف راست (کوه) طور فراخواندیم؛ و نجواکنان او را (به خود) نزدیک ساختیم؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و خواندیمش از کنار راست طور و نزدیک گردانیدیمش رازگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او را از سوى راست كوه طور ندا داديم و به رازگويى نزديكش ساختيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و از پربرکت‌ترین جانب (کوه) طور، او را ندا در دادیم. و در حالی‌که با وی راز می‌گفتیم، او را نجات‌یافته(به خود) نزدیک ساختیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We called him from the right side of the Mount, and brought him close for communion;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We called him from the right side of the mountain Tur, and brought him close to reveal Our secret.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We called to him from the right side Of the Mount, and We brought him near in communion.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We cried unto him from the right side of the mount, and We drew him nigh for whispering.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We called him from the right side of the Mount, and made him draw near to Us for a talk with him [Musa (Moses)].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We called him from the right side of the Mount, and brought him near in communion.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We called out to him from the right side of the Mount, and We drew him near to Us by communing to him in secret,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We called him from the right side of the Mount (Tur), and made him draw near to Us for a talk with him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We called him from the right slope of the Mount, and brought him nigh in communion.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We called him from the right side of the Mount and We drew him near [to Ourselves] for confidential discourse.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We called out to him from the right side of the mountain, and drew him near in (Divine) conversation.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We called him from the right side of Mount Sinai and drew him close for communication.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We called to him from the blessed side of the mountain, and We made him draw nigh, holding communion (with Us).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanadaynahu min janibi alttoori alaymani waqarrabnahu najiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We called out to him from the right side of the mount and made him draw near to be in close communion with Us;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And we called him from the right side of Mount (Sinai), and made him draw near to Us, for mystic (converse).

verses.text: وَ وَهَبْنَا لَهُ‌ مِنْ‌ رَحْمَتِنَا أَخَاهُ‌ هَارُونَ‌ نَبِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و از رحمت خود برادرش هارون را که دارای مقام پیامبری بود، به او بخشیدیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از رحمت خود برادرش هارون پيامبر را به او بخشيديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به رحمت خويش برادرش هارون پيامبر را [براى مساعدت‌] به او بخشيديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به رحمت خويش برادرش هارون پيامبر را به او بخشيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و از لطف و مرحمتی که داشتیم برادرش هارون پیامبر را نیز (برای مشارکت و مساعدت او) به او عطا کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و ما از روی مرحمت خود، برادرش هارون را که پیغمبر بود، بدو دادیم (و او را دستیار و پشتیبانش کردیم). [[«مِن رَّحْمَتِنَا»: به خاطر مرحمت خود. از مرحمت خود. «أَخَاهُ هَارُونَ نَبِیّاً»: واژه (أَخا) مفعول و (هارُونَ) عطف بیان، و (نَبِیّاً) حال هارون است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از رحمت خویش برادری چون هارون که پیامبر [و شریک و یاور او] بود به او ارزانی داشتیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما از رحمت خود، برادرش هارون را -که پیامبر بود- به او بخشیدیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بخشیدیم بدو از رحمت خود برادرش هارون را پیمبری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و به او از رحمت خويش برادرش هارون پيامبر را بخشيديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به رحمت خویش برادرش هارون - پیامبری برجسته- را به او بخشیدیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And bestowed on him his brother Aaron, a prophet, through Our benevolence.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And with Our mercy We bestowed upon him his brother Haroon, a Prophet.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We gave him his brother Aaron, of Our mercy, a Prophet.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We bestowed on him, out of Our mercy, his brother Harun, a prophet.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We bestowed on him his brother Harun (Aaron), (also) a Prophet, out of Our Mercy.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We granted him, out of Our mercy, his brother Aaron, a prophet.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and out of Our mercy We appointed his brother Aaron, a Prophet (that he may assist him).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We granted him his brother Harun, (also) a Prophet, out of Our mercy.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We bestowed upon him of Our mercy his brother Aaron, a prophet (likewise).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron, a prophet.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: From Our Mercy We gave him, his brother Aaron, a Prophet.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Out of Our mercy We gave him his brother Aaron who himself was a Prophet.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We gave to him out of Our mercy his brother Haroun a prophet.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wawahabna lahu min rahmatina akhahu haroona nabiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and We gave him as his helper, out of Our mercy, his brother Aaron, having made him a prophet.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.

verses.text: وَ اذْکُرْ فِي‌ الْکِتَابِ‌ إِسْمَاعِيلَ‌ إِنَّهُ‌ کَانَ‌ صَادِقَ‌ الْوَعْدِ وَ کَانَ‌ رَسُولاً نَبِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در این کتاب، [سرگذشتِ] اسماعیل را یاد کن، که او وفا کننده به عهد و فرستاده ای پیامبر بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و در اين كتاب اسماعيل را ياد كن. او درست‌قول و فرستاده‌اى پيامبر بود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در اين كتاب از اسماعيل ياد كن، همانا او خوش وعده و رسول [و] پيامبرى بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در اين كتاب از اسماعيل ياد كن، زيرا كه او درست‌وعده و فرستاده‌اى پيامبر بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و یاد کن در کتاب خود شرح حال اسماعیل را که بسیار در وعده صادق و رسول و پیغمبری بزرگوار بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در کتاب (آسمانی قرآن) از اسماعیل بگو. آن کسی که در وعده‌هایش راست بود، و پیغمبر والا مقامی بود. [[«کَانَ رَسُولاً نَّبِیّاً»: (نگا: مریم / 51).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در کتاب آسمانی از اسماعیل یاد کن که درست وعده و فرستاده‌ای پیامبر بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در این کتاب (آسمانی) از اسماعیل (نیز) یاد کن، که او در وعده‌هایش صادق، و رسول و پیامبری (بزرگ) بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و یاد کن در کتاب اسماعیل را که او بوده است راست‌وعده و بوده است فرستاده پیمبری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و در اين كتاب، اسماعيل را ياد كن او راست‌وعده و فرستاده‌اى پيامبر بود

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در کتاب، اسماعیل را یاد کن، همانا او راست‌وعده و فرستاده‌ای برجسته بود

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Commemorate Ishmael in the Book. He was true of his promise, and a messenger, a prophet.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And remember Ismail in the Book; he was indeed true to his promise and was a Noble Messenger, a Prophet.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And mention in the Book Ishmael; he was true to his promise, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And mention thou in the Book lsma'i; verily he was true in promise, and was apostle, prophet.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And mention in the Book (the Quran) Isma'il (Ishmael). Verily! He was true to what he promised, and he was a Messenger, (and) a Prophet.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And mention in the Scripture Ishmael. He was true to his promise, and was a messenger, a prophet.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And recite in the Book the account of Ishmael. He was ever true to his promise, and was a Messenger, a Prophet.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And mention in the Book, Isma`il. Verily, he was true to what he promised, and he was a Messenger, (and) a Prophet.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And make mention in the Scripture of Ishmael. Lo! he was a keeper of his promise, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And mention in the Book Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and an apostle and prophet.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And mention in the Book, Ishmael; he too was true to his promise, a Messenger and a Prophet.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Mention in the Book (the Quran) the story of Ishmael; he was true to his promise, a Messengers and a Prophet.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And mention Ismail in the Book; surely he was truthful in (his) promise, and he was an apostle, a prophet.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waothkur fee alkitabi ismaAAeela innahu kana sadiqa alwaAAdi wakana rasoolan nabiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Tell also of Ishmael in the Book. He was true to his promise and was a messenger and a prophet.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Isma'il: He was (strictly) true to what he promised, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.

verses.text: وَ کَانَ‌ يَأْمُرُ أَهْلَهُ‌ بِالصَّلاَةِ وَ الزَّکَاةِ وَ کَانَ‌ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِ‌ مَرْضِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و همواره خانواده اش را به نماز و زکات فرمان می داد، و نزد پروردگارش پسندیده بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و خاندان خود را به نماز و زكات امر مى‌كرد و نزد پروردگارش شايسته و پسنديده بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و خاندان خود را به نماز و زكات فرمان مى‌داد و نزد پروردگارش مورد رضايت بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و خاندان خود را به نماز و زكات فرمان مى‌داد و همواره نزد پروردگارش پسنديده‌[رفتار] بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همیشه اهل بیت خود را به ادای نماز و زکات امر می‌کرد و او نزد خدایش بنده‌ای پسندیده بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او همواره خانواده‌ی خود را به اقامه‌ی نماز و دادن زکات دستور می‌داد، و در پیشگاه پروردگارش مورد رضایت بود. [[«مَرْضِیّاً»: مورد رضایت. اسم مفعول است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و خاندانش را به نماز و زکات امر می‌کرد و نزد پروردگارش مقبول بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او همواره خانواده‌اش را به نماز و زکات فرمان می‌داد؛ و همواره مورد رضایت پروردگارش بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بود می‌فرمود خاندان خود را به نماز و زکات و بود نزد پروردگار خویش پسندیده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خاندان خود را به نماز و زكات فرمان مى‌داد و نزد پروردگارش پسنديده بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و خاندان خود را به نماز و زکات فرمان می‌داد. و نزد پروردگارش پسندیده بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He enjoined on his household worship and zakat, and he was obedient to his Lord.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He used to command his people to offer prayer and give charity, and was liked by his Lord.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He bade his people to pray and to give the alms, and he was pleasing to his Lord.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he was wont to command his household to the Prayer and the poor-rate, and he was with his Lord an approved one. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And he used to enjoin on his family and his people As-Salat (the prayers) and the Zakat, and his Lord was pleased with him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and charity, and he was pleasing to his Lord.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He enjoined his household to observe Prayer and to give Zakah (purifying alms); and his Lord was well pleased with him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And he would enjoin on his family and his people the Salah and the Zakah, and his Lord was pleased with him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He enjoined upon his people worship and almsgiving, and was acceptable in the sight of his Lord.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He used to bid his family to [maintain] the prayer and to [pay] the zakat, and was pleasing to his Lord.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And he ordered his people to pray and to give charity and his Lord was pleased with him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He would order his people to worship God and pay the religious tax. His Lord was pleased with him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And he enjoined on his family prayer and almsgiving, and was one in whom his Lord was well pleased.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wakana yamuru ahlahu bialssalati waalzzakati wakana AAinda rabbihi mardiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He exhorted his people to prayer and almsgiving, and his Lord was pleased with him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He used to enjoin on his people Prayer and Charity, and he was most acceptable in the sight of his Lord.

verses.text: وَ اذْکُرْ فِي‌ الْکِتَابِ‌ إِدْرِيسَ‌ إِنَّهُ‌ کَانَ‌ صِدِّيقاً نَبِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در این کتاب، [سرگذشتِ] ادریس را یاد کن، که او بسیار راستگو و پیامبر بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و در اين كتاب ادريس را ياد كن. او راست‌گفتارى پيامبر بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در اين كتاب از ادريس ياد كن كه او راستگو و پيامبر بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در اين كتاب از ادريس ياد كن كه او راستگويى پيامبر بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و یاد کن در کتاب خود احوال ادریس را که او شخصی بسیار راستگو و پیغمبری عظیم الشأن بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و در کتاب (آسمانی قرآن) از ادریس بگو. او بسیار راستکار و راستگو و پیغمبر بزرگی بود. [[«صِدِّیقاً»: بسیار راست و درست در کردار و گفتار.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در کتاب آسمانی از ادریس یاد کن که صدیقی پیامبر بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در این کتاب، از ادریس (نیز) یاد کن، او بسیار راستگو و پیامبر (بزرگی) بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و یاد کن در کتاب ادریس را که بوده است راستگوی پیمبری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و در اين كتاب، از ادريس ياد كن، همانا او راست‌گفتار پيامبرى بود

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در کتاب، ادریس را یاد کن. او بسی راست(کار و) پیامبری برجسته بود

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Commemorate Enoch in the Book. He was a truthful person and a prophet,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And remember Idrees in the Book; he was indeed very truthful, a Prophet.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And mention in the Book Idris; he was a true man, a Prophet.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And mention thou in the book ldris, verily he was a man of truth, a prophet. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And mention in the Book (the Quran) Idris (Enoch). Verily! He was a man of truth, (and) a Prophet.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And mention in the Scripture Enoch. He was a man of truth, a prophet.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And recite in the Book the account of Idris. He was a man of truth, a Prophet;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And mention in the Book, Idris. Verily, he was a man of truth, (and) a Prophet.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And make mention in the Scripture of Idris. Lo! he was a saint, a prophet;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And mention in the Book Idrees. Indeed, he was a truthful one and a prophet,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And mention in the Book, Idris; he too was of the truth and a Prophet,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Mention in the Book (the Quran) the story of Idris (Enoch); he was a truthful Prophet.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And mention Idris in the Book; surely he was a truthful man, a prophet,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waothkur fee alkitabi idreesa innahu kana siddeeqan nabiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Tell also of Idris in the Book. He was a man of truth and a prophet.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: He was a man of truth (and sincerity), (and) a prophet:

verses.text: وَ رَفَعْنَاهُ‌ مَکَاناً عَلِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و او را به جایگاه و مقام بلندی ارتقا دادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او را به مكانى بلند فرا برديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما او را به مقامى بلند ارتقا داديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [ما] او را به مقامى بلند ارتقا داديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و مقام او را بلند و مرتبه‌اش را رفیع گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما او را به منزلت و مکانت والائی نائل کردیم. [[«رَفَعْنَاهُ»: او را رفعت و منزلت دادیم (نگا: شرح / 4).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او را بلندمرتبه گرداندیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما او را به مقام والایی رساندیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بالا بردیمش جایگاهی بلند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او را به جايگاهى بلند و والا برداشتيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (ما) او را به جایی بلند [:معراج] بالا بردیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And We raised him to an exalted station.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We lifted him to a high position. (Living with soul & body in heaven, after his death.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We raised him up to a high place.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We exalted him to a position lofty. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We raised him to a high station.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We raised him to a high position.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We exalted him to a lofty position.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We raised him to a high station.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We raised him to high station.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and We raised him to an exalted station.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We raised him to a high place.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We raised him to a high station.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We granted him a high position.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We raised him high in Heaven.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WarafaAAnahu makanan AAaliyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We raised him to a high position.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We raised him to a lofty station.

verses.text: أُولٰئِکَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ أَنْعَمَ‌ اللَّهُ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ مِنَ‌ النَّبِيِّينَ‌ مِنْ‌ ذُرِّيَّةِ آدَمَ‌ وَ مِمَّنْ‌ حَمَلْنَا مَعَ‌ نُوحٍ‌ وَ مِنْ‌ ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ‌ وَ إِسْرَائِيلَ‌ وَ مِمَّنْ‌ هَدَيْنَا وَ اجْتَبَيْنَا إِذَا تُتْلَى‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ آيَاتُ‌ الرَّحْمٰنِ‌ خَرُّوا سُجَّداً وَ بُکِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اینان کسانی از پیامبران بودند که خدا به آنان نعمت داد، از نسل آدم و از نسل کسانی که با نوح در کشتی سوار کردیم و از نسل ابراهیم و اسرائیل و از کسانی که آنان را هدایت کردیم و برگزیدیم؛ هنگامی که آیات [خدایِ] رحمان بر آنان خوانده می شد، سجده کنان و گریان به رو می افتادند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اينان گروهى از پيامبران بودند كه خدا به آنان انعام كرده بود، از فرزندان آدم و فرزندان آنان كه با نوح در كشتى نشانديم و فرزندان ابراهيم و اسرائيل و آنها كه هدايتشان كرديم و برگزيديمشان. و چون آيات خداى رحمان بر آنان تلاوت مى‌شد، گريان به سجده مى‌افتادند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آنان گروهى از پيامبران بودند كه خداوند به آنها نعمت [هدايت‌] داد از فرزندان آدم و از كسانى كه همراه نوح بر كشتى سوار كرديم و از فرزندان ابراهيم و يعقوب و از كسانى كه هدايت نموديم و برگزيديم، كه هرگاه آيات خداى رحمان برايشان تلاوت مى‌شد سجده‌كنان و گر

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنان كسانى از پيامبران بودند كه خداوند بر ايشان نعمت ارزانى داشت: از فرزندان آدم بودند و از كسانى كه همراه نوح [بر كشتى‌] سوار كرديم؛ و از فرزندان ابراهيم و اسرائيل و از كسانى كه [آنان را] هدايت نموديم و برگزيديم؛ [و] هر گاه آيات [خداى‌] رحمان بر ايشان خوانده مى‌شد، سجده‌كنان و گريان به خاك مى‌افتادند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اینان (که از زکریا تا ادریس اوصافشان یاد شد) همان رسولانی هستند که خدا از میان همه اولاد آدم و اولاد آنان که با نوح در کشتی نشاندیم و اولاد ابراهیم و یعقوب و دیگر کسان که هدایت کرده و برگزیدیم، آنها را به لطف و انعام خود مخصوص گردانید (و حال آنها در بندگی چنان است) که هرگاه آیات خدای رحمن بر آنها تلاوت شود با گریه (شوق و محبت) روی اخلاص بر خاک نهند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان که پیغمبرانی بودند از سُلاله‌ی آدم، و از فرزندان کسانی که با نوح سوار کشتی کردیم، و از دودمان ابراهیم و یعقوب، و از زمره‌ی کسانی که آنان را (به سوی ایمان) رهنمود و (برای رسالت آسمانی) برگزیده بودیم و بدیشان نعمت (دنیا و آخرت) داده بودیم، هر زمان که آیات خداوند مهربان پیش ایشان تلاوت می‌شد، سجده‌کنان و گریان به خاک می‌افتادند. [[«أولئِکَ»: آنان. یعنی انبیاء و رُسُل دهگانه مذکور، از زکریّا تا ادریس:. «إِسْرَآئِیلَ»: یعقوب. «خَرُّوا»: از بالا فروافتادند. به روی افتادند. «سُجَّداً»: جمع ساجِد، سجده‌کنان. «بُکِیّاً»: جمع باکی، گریه‌کنان. «سُجَّداً وَ بُکِیّاً»: حال اوّل و دوم هستند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اینان کسانی هستند از پیامبران، از زاد و رود آدم و از کسانی که همراه نوح در کشتی سوار کردیم و از زاد و رود ابراهیم و اسرائیل [ یعقوب‌] و از کسانی که هدایت کرده‌ایم و بر گزیده‌ایم، که خداوند به آنان انعام و اکرام فرموده است، که چون آیات خداوند رحمان بر آنان خوانده، می‌شد، گریان به سجده می‌افتادند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها پیامبرانی بودند که خداوند مشمول نعمتشان قرار داده بود، از فرزندان آدم، و از کسانی که با نوح بر کشتی سوار کردیم، و از دودمان ابراهیم و یعقوب، و از کسانی که هدایت کردیم و برگزیدیم. آنها کسانی بودند که وقتی آیات خداوند رحمان بر آنان خوانده می‌شد به خاک می‌افتادند، در حالی که سجده می‌کردند و گریان بودند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: اینانند که بخشید خدا بدیشان از پیمبران از فرزندان آدم و از آنان که سوار کردیم با نوح و از فرزندان ابراهیم و اسرائیل و از آنان که هدایت کردیم و برگزیدیم که هرگاه خوانده شود بر ایشان آیتهای خدای مهربان بیفتند سجده‌کنان و گریان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ايشانند- از زكريا تا الياس- كه خداوند به آنان نعمت ارزانى داشته- نيكويى كرده- پيامبرانى از فرزندان آدم و از [فرزندان‌] آنها كه با نوح [در كشتى‌] برنشانديم و از فرزندان ابراهيم و يعقوب و از آنان كه راه نموديم و برگزيديم چون آيات خداى رحمان بر آنان خوانده شود سجده‌كنان و گريان به روى درافتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ایشان کسانی از پیامبران برجسته‌اند-که خدا بر ایشان نعمت ارزانی داشت- از دودمان آدم و از کسانی که با نوح (در کشتی) سوار(شان) کردیم و (نیز) از دودمان ابراهیم و اسرائیل و از کسانی که (آنان را) هدایت نمودیم و برگزیدیم‌؛ هنگامی که آیات (خدای) رحمان بر ایشان خوانده شود، سجده‌کنان و گریان به خاک فرو افتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: These are (some of) those who were favoured by God among the prophets of the progeny of Adam, and of those We bore in the ark with Noah, and the offspring of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and We chose, for they bowed weeping in adoration when the revelations of Ar-Rahman were recited to them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: It is these upon whom Allah has bestowed favour among the Prophets, from the descendants of Adam; and from those whom We boarded along with Nooh; and from the descendants of Ibrahim and Israel; and from those whom We guided and chose; when the verses of the Most Gracious were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating and weeping. (* Command of Prostration # 5.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: These are they whom God has blessed among the Prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those We bore with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: These are they whom Allah hath favoured, from among the prophets, of the progeny of Adam and of them whom We bare with Nuh, and of the progeny of Ibrahim and Isra'il, and of those whom We have guided and chosen; whenever the revelations of the Compassionate were rehearsed unto them, they fell down prostrating themselves and weeping. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His Grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh (Noah), and of the offspring of Ibrahim (Abraham) and Israel and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Verses of the Most Beneficent (Allah) were recited unto them, they fell down prostrating and weeping.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: These are some of the prophets God has blessed, from the descendants of Adam, and from those We carried with Noah, and from the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and from those We guided and selected. Whenever the revelations of the Most Gracious are recited to them, they would fall down, prostrating and weeping.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: These are the Prophets upon whom Allah bestowed His favour from the seed of Adam, and from the seed of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and from the seed of Abraham and Israel. They were those whom We guided and chose (for an exalted position). They were such that when the words of the Most Compassionate Lord were recited to them, they fell down in prostration, weeping.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Those were they unto whom Allah bestowed His grace from among the Prophets, of the offspring of Adam, and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Nuh, and of the offspring of Ibrahim and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the Ayat of the Most Gracious were recited unto them, they fell down prostrate and weeping.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: These are they unto whom Allah showed favour from among the prophets, of the seed of Adam and of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose. When the revelations of the Beneficent were recited unto them, they fell down, adoring and weeping.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They are the ones whom Allah has blessed from among the prophets of Adam’s progeny, and from [the progeny of] those We carried with Noah, and from among the progeny of Abraham and Israel, and from among those that We guided and chose. When the signs of the All-beneficent were recited to them, they would fall down weeping in prostration.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: These are whom Allah has blessed among the Prophets from among the seed of Adam and of those whom We bore with Noah; the descendants ofAbraham, of Israel, and of those whom We have guided and chose. For when the verses of the Merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrate, weeping.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: These were the Prophets from the offspring of Adam, from those who embarked with Noah and from the offspring of Abraham and Israel. God guided them and chose them for His favor. Whenever they would hear the revelations of the Beneficent God they would bow down in prostration with tears.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: These are they on whom Allah bestowed favors, from among the prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those whom We carried with Nuh, and of the seed of Ibrahim and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose; when the communications of the Beneficent Allah were recited to them, they fell down making obeisance and weeping.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Olaika allatheena anAAama Allahu AAalayhim mina alnnabiyyeena min thurriyyati adama wamimman hamalna maAAa noohin wamin thurriyyati ibraheema waisraeela wamimman hadayna waijtabayna itha tutla AAalayhim ayatu alrrahmani kharroo sujjadan wabukiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: These are the ones whom God has favoured: the prophets from among the descendants of Adam and of those whom We carried in the Ark with Noah; the descendants of Abraham, of Israel, and of those whom We have guided and chosen. For when the revelations of the Merciful were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating themselves and weeping.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.

verses.text: فَخَلَفَ‌ مِنْ‌ بَعْدِهِمْ‌ خَلْفٌ‌ أَضَاعُوا الصَّلاَةَ وَ اتَّبَعُوا الشَّهَوَاتِ‌ فَسَوْفَ‌ يَلْقَوْنَ‌ غَيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس بعد از آنان نسلی جایگزین [آنان] شد که نماز را ضایع کردند و از شهوات پیروی نمودند؛ پس [کیفر] گمراهی خود را [که عذابی دردناک است] خواهند دید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سپس كسانى جانشين اينان شدند كه نماز را ضايع گذاشتند و پيرو شهوات گرديدند و به زودى به غى خواهند افتاد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه كسانى جانشين اينان شدند كه نماز را ضايع كردند و شهوات را پيروى نمودند كه به زودى [سزاى‌] گمراهى را خواهند ديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه، پس از آنان جانشينانى به جاى ماندند كه نماز را تباه ساخته و از هوسها پيروى كردند، و به زودى [سزاى‌] گمراهى [خود] را خواهند ديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: سپس جانشین آن مردم خداپرست قومی شدند که نماز را ضایع گذارده و شهوتهای نفس را پیروی کردند و اینها به زودی کیفر گمراهی را خواهند دید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بعد از آنان، فرزندان ناخلَفی (روی کار آمدند و در زمین) جایگزین شدند که نماز را (ترک کردند و بهره‌مندی از آن را) هدر دادند و به دنبال (لذائذ و) شهوات راه افتادند، و (مجازات) گمراهی (خود را در دنیا و آخرت) خواهند دید. [[«خَلَفَ»: جانشین و جایگزین گردید. بعد از ایشان آمدند. «خَلْفٌ»: فرزندان ناشایست و ناصالح. (خَلْف) با سکون عین‌الفعل، اولاد اَشرار را، و (خَلَف) با فتح عین‌الفعل، اولاد اَخیار را می‌گویند. «غَیّاً»: ضلالت و گمراهی (نگا: بقره / 256). گاهی مثل اینجا مراد نتیجه گمراهی است که عذاب است. و یا این که در «فَسَوْفَ یَلْقَوْنَ غَیّاً»: مضاف محذوف است و تقدیر چنین است: «فَسَوْفَ یَلْقَوْنَ جَزَآءَ غَیٍّ»: (نگا: فرقان / 68).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ولی پس از آنان جانشینان ناخلفی بازماندند که نماز را فرو گذاشتند و از شهوات پیروی کردند، و زودا که با زیان و ذلت رو در رو شوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا پس از آنان، فرزندان ناشایسته‌ای روی کار آمدند که نماز را تباه کردند، و از شهوات پیروی نمودند؛ و بزودی (مجازات) گمراهی خود را خواهند دید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس جانشین شد از پس ایشان پشتی که تباه کردند نماز را و پیروی کردند شهوتها را پس زود است برسند گمراهی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه از پى ايشان جانشينان بد و ناشايسته‌اى آمدند كه نماز را فروگذاشتند- در آن سهل‌انگارى نمودند- و كامها و آرزوهاى دل را پيروى كردند، پس زودا كه [سزاى‌] گمراهى خود را ببينند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بعد از آنان جانشینانی ناپسند بر جای ماندند (که) نماز را ضایع ساخته و از هوس‌ها پیروی کردند. پس در آینده‌ای دور گمراهی را (از روی اعتقاد فاسد) خواهند یافت.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But they are succeeded by a generation who neglect their devotional obligations and follow only earthly pleasures; but they will reach the wrong road and meet destruction,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And after them came the unworthy successors who squandered prayer and pursued their own desires, so they will soon encounter the forest of Gai in hell.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then there succeeded after them a succession who wasted the prayer, and followed lusts; so they shall encounter error

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then there succeeded to them a posterity who neglected the prayers and followed lusts; so presently they shall meet with perdition. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, there has succeeded them a posterity who have given up As-Salat (the prayers) [i.e. made their Salat (prayers) to be lost, either by not offering them or by not offering them perfectly or by not offering them in their proper fixed times, etc.] and have followed lusts. So they will be thrown in Hell.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But they were succeeded by generations who lost the prayers and followed their appetites. They will meet perdition.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They were succeeded by a people who neglected the Prayers and pursued their lusts. They shall presently meet with their doom,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then, there has succeeded them a posterity who have lost the Salah and have followed lusts. So they will meet Ghaiy.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Now there hath succeeded them a later generation whom have ruined worship and have followed lusts. But they will meet deception.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But they were succeeded by an evil posterity who neglected the prayer, and followed [their base] appetites. So they will soon encounter [the reward of] perversity,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But the generation that succeeded them wasted their prayers and followed their desires, so they shall encounter error

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They were succeeded by a generation who neglected their prayers and followed their worldly desires. They will certainly be lost,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But there came after them an evil generation, who neglected prayers and followed and sensual desires, so they win meet perdition,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fakhalafa min baAAdihim khalfun adaAAoo alssalata waittabaAAoo alshshahawati fasawfa yalqawna ghayyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But then they were succeeded by generations who neglected their prayers and were driven by their own desires. They will assuredly meet with destruction,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But after them there followed a posterity who missed prayers and followed after lusts soon, then, will they face Destruction,-

verses.text: إِلاَّ مَنْ‌ تَابَ‌ وَ آمَنَ‌ وَ عَمِلَ‌ صَالِحاً فَأُولٰئِکَ‌ يَدْخُلُونَ‌ الْجَنَّةَ وَ لاَ يُظْلَمُونَ‌ شَيْئاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر آنان که توبه کرده و ایمان آورده و کار شایسته انجام داده اند، پس آنان به بهشت درآیند و ذرّه ای مورد ستم قرار نمی گیرند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر آن كس كه توبه كرد و ايمان آورد و كارهاى شايسته كرد. اينان به بهشت داخل مى‌شوند و هيچ مورد ستم قرار نمى‌گيرند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر كسانى كه توبه كردند و ايمان آوردند و كار شايسته انجام دادند، كه آنها به بهشت داخل شوند و هيچ‌گونه ستمى بر ايشان نرود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر آنان كه توبه كرده و ايمان آورده و كار شايسته انجام دادند، كه آنان به بهشت درمى‌آيند و ستمى بر ايشان نخواهد رفت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مگر آن کس که توبه کند و ایمان آرد و نیکوکار شود، که آنان در این صورت بی‌هیچ ستم به بهشت ابد داخل خواهند شد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر آن کسانی که توبه کنند و (چنان که باید) ایمان بیاورند و کارهای شایسته کنند. این چنین کسانی وارد بهشت می‌شوند و کمترین ستمی بدانان نخواهد شد. [[«لا یُظْلَمُونَ شَیْئاً»: هیچ ستمی بدیشان نمی‌شود. کمترین ظلمی بدیشان نمی‌شود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر کسی که توبه کند و ایمان آورد و کاری شایسته پیشه کند، اینانند که وارد بهشت می‌شوند و هیچ‌گونه ستم [و کم و کاستی‌] نمی‌بینند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر آنان که توبه کنند، و ایمان بیاورند، و کار شایسته انجام دهند؛ چنین کسانی داخل بهشت می‌شوند، و کمترین ستمی به آنان نخواهد شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر آنکه توبه کرد و ایمان آورد و عمل صالح کرد که آنان درآیند بهشت را و ستم نشوند چیزی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر آن كه باز گشت- توبه كرد- و ايمان آورد و كار نيك و شايسته كرد، پس اينان به بهشت در آيند و هيچ ستمى بر آنان نرود،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مگر کسانی که توبه کرده و ایمان آورده و کاری شایسته(ی ایمان) انجام دادند. پس به بهشت در آیند و هیچ ستمی نخواهند دید:

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Except those who repent and come to believe and do the right. These will enter Paradise and will not be wronged the least

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except those who repented and accepted faith and did good deeds – so these will enter heaven, and they will not be deprived* in the least. (* Of their due reward.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: save him who repents, and believes, and does a righteous deed; those -- they shall enter Paradise, and they shall not be wronged anything;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Excepting those who may repent and believe and work righteously; these shall enter the Garden and shall not be wronged at all *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except those who repent and believe (in the Oneness of Allah and His Messenger Muhammad SAW), and work righteousness. Such will enter Paradise and they will not be wronged in aught.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for those who repent, and believe, and act righteously. These will enter Paradise, and will not be wronged in the least.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except those who repent and believe and act righteously. Such shall enter Paradise and shall not be wronged at all.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except those who repent and believe, and work righteousness. Such will enter Paradise and they will not be wronged in aught.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save him who shall repent and believe and do right. Such will enter the Garden, and they will not be wronged in aught -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: barring those who repent, believe, and act righteously. Such will enter paradise, and they will not be wronged in the least.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except he who repents and believes and does good works; those shall be admitted to Paradise and shall not be wronged in any way.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: but those among them who repent and become righteously striving believers will be admitted to the gardens without experiencing any injustice.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Except such as repent and believe and do good, these shall enter the garden, and they shall not be dealt with unjustly in any way:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa man taba waamana waAAamila salihan faolaika yadkhuloona aljannata wala yuthlamoona shayan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: except for those who repent and believe and do good deeds. These will enter Heaven, and they will not be wronged in the least.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Except those who repent and believe, and work righteousness: for these will enter the Garden and will not be wronged in the least,-

verses.text: جَنَّاتِ‌ عَدْنٍ‌ الَّتِي‌ وَعَدَ الرَّحْمٰنُ‌ عِبَادَهُ‌ بِالْغَيْبِ‌ إِنَّهُ‌ کَانَ‌ وَعْدُهُ‌ مَأْتِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بهشت های جاویدی که [خدای] رحمان به بندگانش وعده داده در حالی که اکنون از نظرها پنهان است، یقیناً وعده خدا آمدنی است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بهشتهاى جاويد كه خداى رحمان در غيب به بندگان خويش وعده كرده است و وعده او فرا خواهد رسيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بهشت‌هاى جاودانى كه خداى رحمان بندگانش را به ناديده وعده داده است بى‌ترديد وعده‌ى او آمدنى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: باغهاى جاودانى كه [خداى‌] رحمان به بندگانش در جهان ناپيدا وعده داده است. در حقيقت، وعده او انجام‌شدنى است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن بهشتهای عدنی که خدای مهربان برای بندگان (صالح) خود در غیب این جهان وعده فرمود، و البته وعده خدا یقین به انجام می‌رسد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: باغهای ماندگاریی و جاودانگیی که خداوند مهربان آن را به بندگان خود وعده داده است و ایشان نادیده بدان ایمان دارند. وعده‌ی خدا حتماً تحقّق می‌پذیرد (و روزی آنان بهشت خدا را دیده و بدان وارد می‌گردند). [[«جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ»: (نگا: توبه / 72). جنّاتِ بدل از (الْجَنَّةَ) در آیه قبلی است. «بِالْغَیْبِ»: حرف (بِ) حالیّه و ذوالحال ضمیر (ها) است که عائد موصول و محذوف است. یعنی: بهشت را وعده داده است و از دیده ایشان پنهان است. و یا این که حرف (بِ) سببیّه است و معنی چنین می‌شود: به سبب تصدیق غیب و ایمان بدان. «وَعْد»: مصدر و به معنی اسم مفعول، یعنی مَوْعُود است. «مَأْتِیّاً»: آینده. اسم مفعول و به معنی اسم فاعل است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همان جنات عدن که خداوند رحمان به نادیده به بندگانش وعده داده است، همانا که وعده او وفا خواهد شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: وارد باغهایی جاودانی می‌شوند که خداوند رحمان بندگانش را به آن وعده داده است؛ هر چند آن را ندیده‌اند؛ مسلماً وعده خدا تحقق یافتنی است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بهشتهای جاودانی که وعده داد خدای مهربان بندگان خویش را پنهانی همانا بوده است وعده او آورده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بهشتهايى پاينده كه خداى رحمان بندگان خود را به ناديده و ناپيدا وعده داده همانا وعده او آمدنى است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: باغ‌های جاودانه که (خدای) رحمان بندگانش را (به آن‌ها) در غیب وعده داده است. بی‌گمان وعده‌ی او آمدنی بوده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In the gardens of Eden promised by Ar-Rahman to His creatures in the unknown (future). Verily His promise will come to pass.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Everlasting Gardens of Eden, which the Most Gracious has promised to His bondmen in the unseen; indeed His promise will come.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Gardens of Eden that the All-merciful promised His servants in the Unseen; His promise is ever performed.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Gardens Everlasting, which the Compassionate hath promised unto his bondmen, unseen; verily His premise is ever to be fulfilled. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (They will enter) 'Adn (Eden) Paradise (everlasting Gardens), which the Most Beneficent (Allah) has promised to His slaves in the unseen: Verily! His Promise must come to pass.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The Gardens of Eden, promised by the Most Merciful to His servants in the Unseen. His promise will certainly come true.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Theirs shall be everlasting Gardens which the Most Compassionate Lord has promised His servants in a realm which is beyond the ken of perception. Surely His promise shall he fulfilled.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (They will enter) `Adn Gardens which the Most Gracious has promised to His servants in the unseen. Verily, His promise must come to pass.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Gardens of Eden, which the Beneficent hath promised to His slaves in the unseen. Lo! His promise is ever sure of fulfilment -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Gardens of Eden promised by the All-beneficent to His servants, [while they were still] unseen. Indeed His promise is bound to come to pass.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (They shall enter the) Gardens of Eden, which the Merciful has promised His worshipers in the Unseen. Indeed, His promise shall come.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will be admitted to the garden of Eden which is the unseen promise of the Beneficent God to His servants. The promise of God will certainly come true.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The gardens of perpetuity which the Beneficent Allah has promised to His servants while unseen; surely His promise shall come to pass.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Jannati AAadnin allatee waAAada alrrahmanu AAibadahu bialghaybi innahu kana waAAduhu matiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Theirs shall be the Gardens of Eden, which the All Merciful has promised to His servants without their having seen them, and most surely His promise shall be fulfilled.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Gardens of Eternity, those which (Allah) Most Gracious has promised to His servants in the Unseen: for His promise must (necessarily) come to pass.

verses.text: لاَ يَسْمَعُونَ‌ فِيهَا لَغْواً إِلاَّ سَلاَماً وَ لَهُمْ‌ رِزْقُهُمْ‌ فِيهَا بُکْرَةً وَ عَشِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در آنجا کلام لغو و بیهوده ای نمی شنوند، بلکه آنچه می شنوند فقط سلام و درود است؛ و در آنجا صبح و شام، رزقشان برای آنان [آماده] است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در آنجا سخن لغو نمى‌شنوند، گفتارشان سلام است. و روزيشان هر صبح و شام آماده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در آن جا سخن بيهوده نشنوند جز درود، و صبح و شام روزيشان در آن جا برقرار است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در آنجا سخن بيهوده‌اى نمى‌شنوند، جز درود. و روزى‌شان صبح و شام در آنجا [آماده‌] است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آن بهشت هرگز سخن لغوی نشنوند بلکه همه گفتارشان سلام (و ستایش یکدیگر) است و در آنجا روزی آنها صبح و شام (بی‌هیچ رنج) به آنها می‌رسد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان در آنجا گفتار پوچ و بیهوده‌ای نمی‌شنوند، لیکن درود (یزدان و فرشتگان و مؤمنان) را (می‌شنوند)، صبحگاهان و شامگاهان (و تمام اوان و زمان) خوراک و طعام ایشان آماده است. [[«إِلاّ سَلاماً»: جز درود را. لیکن درود را. مراد سلام یزدان (نگا: یس / 58) و فرشتگان (نگا: رعد / 24) و مؤمنان (نگا: ابراهیم / 23) است. «بُکْرَةً وَ عَشِیّاً»: صبح و شام. مراد همه اوقات است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در آنجا هیچ‌گونه لغوی نشنوند و جز سلام نشنوند، و بامدادان و شامگاهان در آنجا رزقشان برقرار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در آن جا هرگز گفتار لغو و بیهوده‌ای نمی‌شنوند؛ و جز سلام در آن جا سخنی نیست؛ و هر صبح و شام، روزی آنان در بهشت مقرّر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نشنوند در آن جز درودی و ایشان را است روزیشان در آن بامداد و شب‌هنگام‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در آنجا سخن ياوه و بيهوده نشنوند، [و گفتارشان‌] جز سلام [نيست‌]. و در آنجا هر بامداد و شبانگاه روزى دارند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در آنجا سخن بیهوده‌ای نمی‌شنوند، جز سلامی، و روزیشان برایشان صبح و شام در آنجا (آماده) است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will hear no vain talk there, but only salutations of peace, and they will have their sustenance morning and evening."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They will not hear any lewd talk in it, but only Peace; and in it for them is sustenance, every morning and evening.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: There they shall hear no idle talk, but only 'Peace.' There they shall have their provision at dawn and evening.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They shall not hear therein any vain word, but they shall hear only peace; and therein they shall have their provision morning and evening. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They shall not hear therein (in Paradise) any Laghw (dirty, false, evil vain talk), but only Salam (salutations of peace). And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and afternoon. [See (V. 40:55)].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will hear no nonsense therein, but only peace. And they will have their provision therein, morning and evening.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They shall not hear in it anything vain; they shall hear only what is good; and they shall have their provision in it, morning and evening.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They shall not hear therein any Laghw, but only Salam. And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and afternoon.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They hear therein no idle talk, but only Peace; and therein they have food for morn and evening.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Therein they will not hear vain talk, but only ‘Peace!’ Therein they will have their provision morning and evening.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: There, they shall hear no idle talk, but only peace. And there they shall be given their provision at dawn and at the evening.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will not hear therein any meaningless words. They will be greeted (by the angels) with "Peace be with you," and they will receive their sustenance both in the mornings and evenings.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They shall not hear therein any vain discourse, but only: Peace, and they shall have their sustenance therein morning and evening.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yasmaAAoona feeha laghwan illa salaman walahum rizquhum feeha bukratan waAAashiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will not hear therein anything vain, only greetings of peace. They will receive their provision there morning and evening.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They will not there hear any vain discourse, but only salutations of Peace: And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and evening.

verses.text: تِلْکَ‌ الْجَنَّةُ الَّتِي‌ نُورِثُ‌ مِنْ‌ عِبَادِنَا مَنْ‌ کَانَ‌ تَقِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این است بهشتی که به هر کس از بندگان خود که پرهیزکار باشد، به میراث می دهیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اين همان بهشتى است كه به بندگانمان، آنها كه پرهيزگارى كرده‌اند، عطا مى‌كنيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اين همان بهشتى است كه به هر يك از بندگان ما كه پرهيزگار باشد به ميراث دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اين همان بهشتى است كه به هر يك از بندگان ما كه پرهيزگار باشند به ميراث مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این همان بهشتی است که ما بندگان پاک متقی خود را بالخصوص وارث آن می‌گردانیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این است بهشتی که ما آن را به بندگان خود - به آن کسانی که پرهیزگار باشند - می‌دهیم. [[«نُورِثُ مَنْ»: به تملیک کسی در می‌آوریم که. «تَقِیّاً»: پرهیزگار. خداترس.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: این بهشتی است که به بندگان پرهیزگار خود میراث می‌دهیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این همان بهشتی است که به بندگان پرهیزگار خود، به ارث می‌دهیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: این است آن بهشتی که ارث دهیم بندگان خود را آنکو بوده است پرهیزکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اين بهشتى است كه به هر كس از بندگانمان كه پرهيزگار باشد به ميراث دهيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آن (بزرگْ مکان) همان بهشتی است که هر یک از بندگانمان را که پرهیزگار بوده‌اند به میراث می‌دهیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: This is the Paradise those of Our creatures will inherit who take heed and fear the displeasure of God.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: It is the Paradise that We will bequeath to those among Our bondmen who remain pious.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: That is Paradise which We shall give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who are godfearing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Such is the Garden which We shall cause those of Our bondmen to inherit who have been God-fearing. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Such is the Paradise which We shall give as an inheritance to those of Our slaves who have been Al-Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - See V. 2:2).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Such is Paradise which We will give as inheritance to those of Our servants who are devout.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Such is the Paradise which We shall cause those of Our servants who have been God-fearing to inherit.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Such is the Paradise which We shall give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who had Taqwa.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Such is the Garden which We cause the devout among Our bondmen to inherit.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: This is the paradise We will give as inheritance to those of Our servants who are Godwary.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: That is the Paradise which We shall give the cautious worshipers to inherit.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Such are the gardens which We will give to Our God-fearing servants as their inherited property.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: This is the garden which We cause those of Our servants to inherit who guard (against evil).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Tilka aljannatu allatee noorithu min AAibadina man kana taqiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: That is the Garden which We will grant to those of Our servants who have been God-fearing.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Such is the Garden which We give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who guard against Evil.

verses.text: وَ مَا نَتَنَزَّلُ‌ إِلاَّ بِأَمْرِ رَبِّکَ‌ لَهُ‌ مَا بَيْنَ‌ أَيْدِينَا وَ مَا خَلْفَنَا وَ مَا بَيْنَ‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ وَ مَا کَانَ‌ رَبُّکَ‌ نَسِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [ای رسول خدا! ما فرشتگان] جز به فرمان پرودگارت نازل نمی شویم. [آگاهی به] آنچه مربوط به آینده ماست و آنچه مربوط به گذشته ماست وآنچه میان گذشته و آینده است، ویژه اوست؛ و پروردگارت هیچ گاه فراموشکار نیست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ما جز به فرمان پروردگار تو فرود نمى‌آييم. آنچه در پيش روى ما و پشت سر ما و ميان اين دو قرار دارد از آنِ اوست. و پروردگار تو فراموشكار نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [جبرئيل گفت:] ما جز به فرمان پروردگار تو فرود نمى‌آييم. از آن اوست گذشته و آينده‌ى ما و آنچه ميان اين دو است. و پروردگار تو فراموشكار نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [ما فرشتگان‌] جز به فرمان پروردگارت نازل نمى‌شويم. آنچه پيش روى ما و آنچه پشت سر ما و آنچه ميان اين دو است، [همه‌] به او اختصاص دارد، و پروردگارت هرگز فراموشكار نبوده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما (رسولان و فرشتگان خدا) جز به امر خدای تو از عالم بالا نازل نمی‌شویم، اوست که بر همه جهانهای پیش رو و پشت سر ما و بین آنها هر چه هست به احاطه علمی آگاه است و پروردگارت هرگز چیزی را فراموش نخواهد کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما (فرشتگان، بندگان جان و دل بر کف یزدان) جز به فرمان پروردگارت فرود نمی‌آئیم (و به کره‌ی زمین گام نمی‌گذاریم). از آن او است آنچه پیش روی ما و آنچه پشت سرِ ما و آنچه میان این دو است و پروردگارت فراموشکار نبوده (و نیست). [[«مَا نَتَنَزَّلُ ...»: فرود نمی‌آئیم. مدّتی جبرئیل پیک وحی پیش پیغمبر نیامد. کافران گفتند: پروردگارش او را فراموش کرده است. هنگامی که جبرئیل مجدّدا نازل شد، علّت تأخیر را پرسید. او آیه فوق را برخواند. «مَا بَیْنَ أَیْدِینَا»: مراد زمان آینده، یا امکنه و جهات پیش روی ما است. «مَا خَلْفَنَا»: مراد زمان گذشته، یا امکنه و جهات پشت سر ما است. «مَا بَیْنَ ذلِکَ»: مراد زمان حال، یا امکنه و جهاتی است که در آن بسر می‌بریم. «لَهُ مَا بَیْنَ أَیْدِینَا وَ مَا خَلْفَنَا وَ مَا بَیْنَ ذلِکَ»: آینده و گذشته و حال، و اینجا و آنجا و همه‌جا، و دنیا و آخرت و برزخ، همه متعلّق به ذات پاک پروردگار است. «نَسِیّاً»: رهاکننده. فراموشکار. صیغه مبالغه ناسی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [جبرئیل گفت‌] و ما جز به فرمان پروردگار فرود نمی‌آییم، او حاکم آینده و گذشته و حال ماست و پروردگارت فراموشکار نیست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (پس از تأخیر وحی، جبرئیل به پیامبر عرض کرد:) ما جز بفرمان پروردگار تو، نازل نمی‌شویم؛ آنچه پیش روی ما، و پشت سر ما، و آنچه میان این دو می‌باشد، همه از آن اوست؛ و پروردگارت هرگز فراموشکار نبوده (و نیست)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و فرود نیائیم مگر به دستور پروردگار تو وی را است آنچه پیش روی ما است و آنچه پشت سر ما و آنچه میان آن است و نیست پروردگار تو فراموش‌کننده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما [فرشتگان‌] جز به فرمان پروردگار تو فرود نمى‌آييم. او راست آنچه فراپيش ماست- امور آينده- و آنچه پشت سر ماست- امور گذشته- و آنچه ميان آن است. و پروردگار تو فراموشكار نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (ما فرشتگان) جز به امر پروردگارت نازل نمی‌شویم. آنچه پیش روی ما و آنچه پشت سر ما و آنچه میان این دو است (همه) تنها برای اوست و پروردگارت هرگز فراموشکار نبوده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "We do not come down," (will the angels say) "but only by your Lord's command." To Him belongs whatever lies before us and behind us, and the space in between. Your Lord does not ever forget:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: (Said Angel Jibreel to Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon them) “And we angels do not come down except by the command of your Lord; to Him only belongs all that is ahead of us and all that is behind us and all that is between them; and your Lord is not forgetful.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We come not down, save at the commandment of thy Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us, and all that is behind us, and all between that.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And we descend not except by the command of thy Lord: his is whatsoever is before us and whatsoever is behind us and whatsoever is in-between; and thy Lord is not a forgetter *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
