translations.text: And we (angels) descend not except by the Command of your Lord (O Muhammad SAW). To Him belongs what is before us and what is behind us, and what is between those two, and your Lord is never forgetful,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “We do not descend except by the command of your Lord. His is what is before us, and what is behind us, and what is between them. Your Lord is never forgetful.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (The angels will say): "(O Muhammad!) We descend not except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us and all that is behind us, and all that is in between. Your Lord is not forgetful in the least.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And we descend not except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs what is before us and what is behind us, and what is between those two; and your Lord is never forgetful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We (angels) come not down save by commandment of thy Lord. Unto Him belongeth all that is before us and all that is behind us and all that is between those two, and thy Lord was never forgetful -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [O Gabriel, tell the Prophet,] ‘We do not descend except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us and whatever is behind us and whatever is in between that, and your Lord does not forget

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (Gabriel said:) 'We do not descend except at the command of your Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us and all that is behind us, and all that lies between. Your Lord does not forget.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Gabriel said], "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), we (the angels) do not come to you without being commanded by your Lord to do so. To Him belongs all that is before us, behind us, and in between. Your Lord is not forgetful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And we do not descend but by the command of your Lord; to Him belongs whatever is before us and whatever is behind us and whatever is between these, and your Lord is not forgetful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama natanazzalu illa biamri rabbika lahu ma bayna aydeena wama khalfana wama bayna thalika wama kana rabbuka nasiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We never descend except at your Lord's command. What is before us and behind us and all that lies between belong to Him. Your Lord is not forgetful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (The angels say:) "We descend not but by command of thy Lord: to Him belongeth what is before us and what is behind us, and what is between: and thy Lord never doth forget,-

verses.text: رَبُ‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ مَا بَيْنَهُمَا فَاعْبُدْهُ‌ وَ اصْطَبِرْ لِعِبَادَتِهِ‌ هَلْ‌ تَعْلَمُ‌ لَهُ‌ سَمِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [اوست] پروردگار آسمان ها و زمین و آنچه میان آن دو قرار دارد؛ پس او را بِپرَست و بر پرستیدنش شکیبا باش. آیا برای او همنامی می دانی [که او هم پروردگار آسمان ها و زمین باشد؟!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمين و آنچه ميان آن دوست. او را بپرست و در پرستش شكيبا باش. آيا همنامى براى او مى‌شناسى؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اوست پروردگار آسمان‌ها و زمين و آنچه ميان آن دو است، پس او را بندگى كن و در عبادت او شكيبا باش. آيا همنامى براى او مى‌شناسى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمين و آنچه ميان آن دو است. پس او را بپرست و در پرستش او شكيبا باش. آيا براى او همنامى مى‌شناسى؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همان خدایی که آفریننده آسمانها و زمین است و هر چه بین آنهاست، پس باید همان خدای یکتا را پرستش کنی و البته در راه بندگی او صبر و تحمل کن (که اگر او را به خدایی نپرستی) آیا دیگری را مانند او به نام خدا (یی لایق پرستش) خواهی یافت؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمین و آنچه در میان این دو است. پس (حال که چنین است و همه‌ی خطوط بدو منتهی می‌شود) تنها او را پرستش کن، و بر عبادت او بر دوام و شکیبا باش. مگر شبیه و همانندی برای خدا (که خالق، رازق، عالم، قادر، حیّ، قیّوم و ... باشد) پیدا خواهی کرد (تا دست نیاز به سوی او دراز کنی؟). [[«رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَ ...»: (رَبُّ) بدل از (رَبُّ) آیه قبلی است. «إِصْطَبِرْ»: شکیبا باش. بر دوام باش. «سَمِیّاً»: همنام. مثل و مانند. شبیه و نظیر (نگا: مریم / 7، شوری / 11).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمین و آنچه در میان آنهاست، پس او را بپرست، و در عبادت او شکیبایی پیشه کن، آیا همنام و همانندی بر او می‌شناسی؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همان پروردگار آسمانها و زمین، و آنچه میان آن دو قرار دارد! او را پرستش کن؛ و در راه عبادتش شکیبا باش! آیا مثل و مانندی برای او می‌یابی؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پروردگار آسمانها و زمین و آنچه میان آنها است پس پرستش کن او را و شکیبائی گزین برای پرستش او آیا می‌دانی برای او همنامی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: خداوند آسمانها و زمين و آنچه در ميان آنهاست، پس او را بپرست و بر پرستش او شكيبا باش آيا براى او هيچ همنامى- كه او را الله خوانند- مى شناسى؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پروردگار آسمان‌ها و زمین و آنچه میان آن دو است. پس او را بپرست و برای پرستش او بسی شکیبا باش. آیا برای او(همتا و) همنامی می‌شناسی‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them. Therefore worship Him, and be constant in His worship. Do you know any namesake of His?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them – therefore worship Him and be firm in His worship; do you know any other of the same name as His?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And thy Lord is never forgetful, Lord He of the heavens and earth and all that is between them. So serve Him, and be thou patient in His service; knowest thou any that can be named with His Name?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and that which is betwixt the twain; so Him worship thou, and endure patiently in His worship; knowest thou any as his compeer? *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, so worship Him (Alone) and be constant and patient in His worship. Do you know of any who is similar to Him? (of course none is similar or coequal or comparable to Him, and He has none as partner with Him). [There is nothing like unto Him and He is the All-Hearer, the All-Seer].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them. So worship Him, and persevere in His service. Do you know of anyone equal to Him?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between. Serve Him, then, and be constant in serving Him. Do you know anyone that might be His compeer?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, so worship Him and abide patiently in His worship. Do you know of any who is similar to Him

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them! Therefor, worship thou Him and be thou steadfast in His service. Knowest thou one that can be named along with Him?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them. So worship Him and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know anyone who could be His namesake?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, so worship Him, be patient in His worship. Do you know any that can be named with His Name'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them. Worship Him and be steadfast in your worship of Him; none is equal to Him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, so serve Him and be patient in His service. Do you know any one equal to Him?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Rabbu alssamawati waalardi wama baynahuma faoAAbudhu waistabir liAAibadatihi hal taAAlamu lahu samiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth and of all that is between the two. So worship Him alone and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know of anyone equal to Him in His attributes?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"

verses.text: وَ يَقُولُ‌ الْإِنْسَانُ‌ أَ إِذَا مَا مِتُ‌ لَسَوْفَ‌ أُخْرَجُ‌ حَيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و انسان می گوید: آیا زمانی که بمیرم به راستی زنده [از خاک] بیرونم می آورند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آدمى مى‌گويد: آيا زمانى كه بميرم، زنده از گور بيرون آورده خواهم شد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و انسان مى‌گويد: آيا وقتى مردم، راستى از گور زنده بيرون آورده خواهم شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و انسان مى‌گويد: «آيا وقتى بميرم، راستى زنده [از قبر] بيرون آورده مى‌شوم؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و انسان (بیچاره در امر معاد شک کند و) گوید: آیا چون من بمیرم باز به زودی مرا از قبر بیرون آورده و زنده خواهند کرد؟!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: انسان می‌گوید: آیا هنگامی که مُردَم (و فانی شدم، از گور) زنده بیرون آورده خواهم شد؟! [[«إِذَا مَا»: هر زمان که. «حَیّاً»: زنده. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و انسان [منکر] گوید آیا چون مردم به زودی زنده برانگیخته خواهم شد؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: انسان می‌گوید: «آیا پس از مردن، زنده (از قبر) بیرون خواهم آمد؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گوید انسان آیا هر گاه بمُردم هر آینه بزودی برون آورده می‌شوم زنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آدمى گويد: آيا هنگامى كه بميرم، مرا زنده [از گور] بيرون خواهند آورد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و انسان می‌گوید: «آیا هنگامی‌که بمیرم، به‌راستی در آینده‌ای دور زنده (از قبر) بیرون آورده می‌شوم‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet man says: "When I am dead, will I come to life again?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And says man, “When I am dead, will I soon be brought forth alive?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Man says, 'What, when I am dead shall I then be brought forth alive?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And man saith: when I am daed, Shall I be presently brought forth alive. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And man (the disbeliever) says: "When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the human being says, “When I am dead, will I be brought back alive?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Man is prone to say: "Shall I be raised to life after I die?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And man says: "When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And man saith: When I am dead, shall I forsooth be brought forth alive?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Man says, ‘What? Shall I be brought forth alive [from the grave], when I have been dead?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The human says: 'What, when I am dead, shall I be raised to life'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The human being says, "Shall I be brought to life again after I will die?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And says man: What! when I am dead shall I truly be brought forth alive?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wayaqoolu alinsanu aitha ma mittu lasawfa okhraju hayyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Man asks, "When I am once dead, shall I be raised to life?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Man says: "What! When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"

verses.text: أَ وَ لاَ يَذْکُرُ الْإِنْسَانُ‌ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُ‌ مِنْ‌ قَبْلُ‌ وَ لَمْ‌ يَکُ‌ شَيْئاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا انسان به یاد نمی آورد [و توجه ندارد] که ما او را پیش از این در حالی که چیزی نبود، آفریدیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آدمى به ياد ندارد كه او را پيش از اين آفريده‌ايم و او خود چيزى نبوده است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا انسان به خاطر نمى‌آورد كه ما او را قبلا آفريديم در حالى كه چيزى نبود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا انسان به ياد نمى‌آورد كه ما او را قبلاً آفريده‌ايم و حال آنكه چيزى نبوده است؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آدمی (برای ایمان به معاد) متذکر آن نمی‌شود که اول که هیچ محض و معدوم صرف بود ما او را ایجاد کردیم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا انسان به خاطر نمی‌آورد که ما او را پیش از این آفریدیم و او اصلاً چیزی نبود؟! (مگر این واقعیّت را فراموش کرده است که بازآفرینی از نوآفرینی، و اعاده‌ی خلق به وجود در زمان آینده، از هستی بخشیدن او از عدم در زمان گذشته، ساده‌تر است؟). [[«وَ لَمْ یَکُ شَیْئاً»: در حالی که چیزی نبود. یعنی نیست بود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا [این‌] انسان نمی‌اندیشد که ما در گذشته او را آفریده‌ایم و حال آنکه چیزی نبود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا انسان به خاطر نمی‌آورد که ما پیش از این او را آفریدیم در حالی که چیزی نبود؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا یاد نمی‌آورد انسان که ما آفریدیمش از پیش حالی که نبود به چیزی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آدمى به ياد نمى‌آورد كه ما او را از پيش بيافريديم و هيچ چيز نبود؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا و (این) انسان به یاد نمی‌آورد (که) ما او را به‌درستی از پیش آفریدیم. حال آنکه (هرگز) چیزی نبوده است‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Does man not remember that before We created him he was nothing?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Does not man remember that We created him before this, and he was non existent?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Will not man remember that We created him aforetime, when he was nothing?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Remembereth not man that We created him afore when he was not aught? *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Does not man remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Does the human being not remember that We created him before, when he was nothing?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Does man not remember that We created him before when he was nothing?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Does not man remember that We created him before, while he was nothing

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Doth not man remember that We created him before, when he was naught?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Does not man remember that We created him before when he was nothing?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Will the human not remember that We created him before when he was not a thing.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Does he not remember that We created him when he did not exist?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Does not man remember that We created him before, when he was nothing?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awala yathkuru alinsanu anna khalaqnahu min qablu walam yaku shayan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But does man not remember that We created him when he was nothing before?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?

verses.text: فَوَ رَبِّکَ‌ لَنَحْشُرَنَّهُمْ‌ وَ الشَّيَاطِينَ‌ ثُمَ‌ لَنُحْضِرَنَّهُمْ‌ حَوْلَ‌ جَهَنَّمَ‌ جِثِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به پروردگارت سوگند، آنان را [که بدون دلیل و از روی جهل و نادانی منکر زنده شدن مردگانند] با شیاطین محشور می کنیم، سپس آنان را در حالی که به زانو درآمده اند، گرداگرد دوزخ حاضر خواهیم کرد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به پروردگارت سوگند، آنها را با شيطانها گردمى‌آوريم؛ آنگاه همه را در اطراف جهنم به زانو مى‌نشانيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به پروردگارت سوگند كه حتما آنها را همراه شياطين گرد مى‌آوريم، آن‌گاه همه را به زانو نشسته پيرامون جهنم حاضر مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، به پروردگارت سوگند كه آنها را با شياطين محشور خواهيم ساخت، سپس در حالى كه به زانو درآمده‌اند، آنان را گرداگرد دوزخ حاضر خواهيم كرد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: قسم به خدای تو که البته آنها را با شیاطین در قیامت محشور می‌گردانیم، آن‌گاه همه را احضار خواهیم کرد تا گرد آتش جهنم به زانو درآیند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سوگند به پروردگارت، هر آینه کافران را همراه با شیاطین گرد می‌آوریم و سپس ایشان را گرداگرد دوزخ به زانو درافتاده و ذلیلانه حاضر می‌سازیم. [[«الشَّیَاطِینَ»: مراد شیاطین قرین و همدم ایشان در دنیا است که آنان را وسوسه می‌کردند و یا معبودشان بودند. «جِثِیّاً»: جمع جاثی، به زانو درآمدگان. بر زانو نشستن ایشان، بر اثر ضعف و زبونی آنان، و یا برای اهانت بدیشان است. این واژه حال بوده و تصویری از بیچارگی و ناتوانی کافران است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سوگند به پروردگارت که آنان و شیاطین را گرد می‌آوریم سپس همه‌شان را پیرامون جهنم به زانو در افتاده حاضر می‌گردانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سوگند به پروردگارت که همه آنها را همراه با شیاطین در قیامت جمع می‌کنیم؛ سپس همه را -در حالی که به زانو درآمده‌اند- گرداگرد جهنم حاضر می‌سازیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سوگند به پروردگار تو هر آینه گردآوریمشان البته با شیاطین پس احضارشان کنیم البته پیرامون دوزخ بر زانو نشستگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: به پروردگار تو سوگند كه آنان را با شيطانها برانگيزيم و فراهم آريم، سپس آنها را گرداگرد دوزخ به زانو در آمده حاضر كنيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس، به پروردگارت سوگند (که) همانا آنان را بی‌گمان با شیطان‌‌ها-بدون برگشت- گردهم می‌آوریم؛ سپس در حالی که به زانو در آمده‌اند، بی‌گمان آنان را بی‌چون گرداگرد دوزخ - به پای درافتاده - حاضر خواهیم کرد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: By your Lord, We shall gather them and the devils together, then bring them crawling on their knees around Hell.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So by your Lord, We shall assemble them and the devils – all of them – and bring them around hell, fallen on their knees.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Now, by thy Lord, We shall surely muster them, and the Satans, then We shall parade them about Gehenna hobbling on their knees.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By thy Lord, then, We shall surely gather them and the satans; thereafter We shall surely bring them round Hell, kneeling. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So by your Lord, surely, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Shayatin (devils) (with them), then We shall bring them round Hell on their knees.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: By your Lord, We will round them up, and the devils, then We will bring them around Hell, on their knees.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: By your Lord, We will surely muster them and the devils together. Then We will surely bring them all, on their knees, around Hell,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So by your Lord, surely We shall gather them together, and (also) the Shayatin, then We shall bring them round Hell, Jithyya.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And, by thy Lord, verily We shall assemble them and the devils, then We shall bring them, crouching, around hell.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: By your Lord, We will surely gather them with the devils; then We will surely bring them up around hell [scrambling] on their knees.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: By your Lord, We will gather them and the satans, and We shall parade them hobbling on their knees in Gehenna:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: By your Lord, We will bring them back to life with satan and gather them around hell in large groups.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So by your Lord! We will most certainly gather them together and the Shaitans, then shall We certainly cause them to be present round hell on their knees.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fawarabbika lanahshurannahum waalshshayateena thumma lanuhdirannahum hawla jahannama jithiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: By your Lord, We shall most surely gather them and the devils too; and bring them close to hell on their knees.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So, by thy Lord, without doubt, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth on their knees round about Hell;

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ لَنَنْزِعَنَ‌ مِنْ‌ کُلِ‌ شِيعَةٍ أَيُّهُمْ‌ أَشَدُّ عَلَى‌ الرَّحْمٰنِ‌ عِتِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن گاه از هر گروهی، آنان که بر خدای رحمان عاصی و سرکش تر بوده اند، بیرون می کشیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه از هر گروه كسانى را كه در برابر خداى رحمان بيشتر سركشى كرده‌اند جدا مى‌كنيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: وانگهى از هر گروه كسانى را كه در بر خداى رحمان سركش‌تر بودند بيرون مى‌كشيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه از هر دسته‌اى، كسانى از آنان را كه بر [خداى‌] رحمان سركش‌تر بوده‌اند، بيرون خواهيم كشيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: سپس هر که عتوّ و سرکشی بر فرمان خدای مهربان بیشتر کرده یک یک را از هر فرقه بیرون آریم (تا به دوزخ درافکنیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس از میان هر گروهی افرادی را بیرون می‌کشیم (و پیش از دیگران به دوزخ می‌اندازیم) که سرکش‌تر از همه در برابر خداوند مهربان بوده‌اند. [[«لَنَنْزِعَنَّ»: قطعاً و مسلّماً بیرون می‌کشیم و جدا می‌کنیم (و پیشاپیش روانه دوزخ می‌سازیم) (نگا: هود / 98). «شِیعَةٍ»: گروه و دسته. جماعت. «عِتِیّاً»: مصدر است و به معنی: تکبّر و تمرّد و سرکشی و طغیان. تمییز است. یا این که جمع عاتی، به معنی: متمرّدان و سرکشان و طاغیان و یاغیان. حال (هُمْ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه از میان آنان از هر فرقه‌ای هر کدام را که در برابر خدای رحمان سرکش‌ترند جدا می‌سازیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس از هر گروه و جمعیّتی، کسانی را که در برابر خداوند رحمان از همه سرکش تر بوده‌اند، جدا می‌کنیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس البته برگیریم از هر گروهی هر کدام را از ایشان که سخت‌تر است بر خدای مهربان در سرکشی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس از ميان هر گروهى هر كدامشان را كه بر خداى رحمان گستاخ‌تر و سركش‌تر بوده بيرون كشيم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس از هر دسته‌ای، کسانی از آنان را که بر (خدای) رحمان سرکش‌ترند همانا به‌راستی بیرون خواهیم کشید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We shall pull out of every section those who were most perversely rebellious against Ar-Rahman.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We shall then pick out from every group the one who was most arrogant towards the Most Gracious.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then We shall pluck forth from every party whichever of them was the most hardened in disdain of the All-merciful;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Thereafter, We shall surely draw aside, from each sect, whichever of them against the Compassionate were most in excess. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then indeed We shall drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against the Most Beneficent (Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, out of every sect, We will snatch those most defiant to the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and then We will draw aside from each party those who were most rebellious against the Most Compassionate Lord,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then indeed We shall drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against the Most Gracious.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then We shall pluck out from every sect whichever of them was most stubborn in rebellion to the Beneficent.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then from every group We shall draw whichever of them was more defiant towards the All-beneficent.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: from every party We will pluck out whichever of them was the most hardened in disdain of the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Then We will separate from every group those who were strongly rebellious against the Beneficent God.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We will most certainly draw forth from every sect of them him who is most exorbitantly rebellious against the Beneficent Allah.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma lananziAAanna min kulli sheeAAatin ayyuhum ashaddu AAala alrrahmani AAitiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then We shall carry off from every group those who were most stubborn in their opposition to the Gracious One,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then shall We certainly drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against (Allah) Most Gracious.

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ لَنَحْنُ‌ أَعْلَمُ‌ بِالَّذِينَ‌ هُمْ‌ أَوْلَى‌ بِهَا صِلِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس ما به کسانی که برای سوختن در دوزخ سزاوارترند، داناتریم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ما آنهايى را كه سزاوارتر به داخل شدن در آتش و سوختن در آن باشند، بهتر مى‌شناسيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه ما كسانى را كه براى سوختن در آتش سزاوارترند بهتر مى‌شناسيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس از آن، به كسانى كه براى درآمدن به [جهنّم‌] سزاوارترند خود داناتريم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن‌گاه ما آنهایی را که سزاوارتر به درآمدن به آتش دوزخند بهتر می‌شناسیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بعد از آن، ما از کسانی که برای سوختن در آتش اولویّت دارند، به خوبی آگاهیم (و دقیقاً افراد گستاخ را انتخاب می‌کنیم و در این گزینش هیچ گونه اشتباهی رخ نخواهد داد). [[«صِلِیّاً»: مصدر است و به معنی: به آتش درآمدن و بریان شدن و سوختن بدان. تمییز است. یا این که جمع صالی و به معنی: به آتش در آیندگان و بریان شدگان و سوختگان بدان. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه ما بهتر می‌دانیم که کدامشان سزاوارتر به درافتادن به میان آن هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بعد از آن، ما بخوبی از کسانی که برای سوختن در آتش سزاوارترند، آگاهتریم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس ما هر آینه داناتریم بدانان که سزاوارترند بدان چشیدن را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه هر آينه ما به كسانى كه به در آمدن و سوختن در آن سزاوارترند داناتريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس به کسانی که برای آتش‌افروزی جهنم سزاوارترند، همانا خود داناتریم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We know best who deserve to be burnt in (the Fire).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Moreover, We well know those who most deserve to be burned in hell.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then We shall know very well those most deserving to burn there.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then surely it is We who are the Best Knower of these worthiest of being therein roasted. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, verily, We know best those who are most worthy of being burnt therein.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We are fully aware of those most deserving to scorch in it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and then We shall know well all those most worthy to be cast in Hell.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then, verily, We know best those who are most worthy of being burnt therein.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And surely We are Best Aware of those most worthy to be burned therein.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then surely We will know best those who deserve most to enter it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We alone know who deserves most to be burned therein.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We know best who deserves greater suffering in hell fire.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Again We do certainly know best those who deserve most to be burned therein.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma lanahnu aAAlamu biallatheena hum awla biha siliyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We surely know best those most deserving of the fires of hell,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And certainly We know best those who are most worthy of being burned therein.

verses.text: وَ إِنْ‌ مِنْکُمْ‌ إِلاَّ وَارِدُهَا کَانَ‌ عَلَى‌ رَبِّکَ‌ حَتْماً مَقْضِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هیچ کس از شما نیست مگر آنکه وارد دوزخ می شود، [ورود همگان به دوزخ] بر پروردگارت مسلّم و حتمی است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و هيچ يك از شما نيست كه وارد جهنم نشود، و اين حكمى است حتمى از جانب پروردگار تو.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همه شما بدون استثنا وارد جهنم مى‌شويد كه اين كار بر خداى تو حتمى و قطعى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ كس از شما نيست مگر [اينكه‌] در آن وارد مى‌گردد. اين [امر] همواره بر پروردگارت حكمى قطعى است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هیچ یک از شما (نوع بشر) باقی نماند جز آنکه به دوزخ وارد شود؛ این حکم حتمی پروردگار توست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همه‌ی شما (انسانها بدون استثناء) وارد دوزخ می‌شوید (مؤمنان برای عبور و دیدن، و کافران برای دخول و ماندن). این امر حتمی و فرمانی است قطعی از پروردگارتان. [[«إِن مِنکُمْ»: کسی از شما نیست مگر. «وَارِدُهَا»: وارد آن می‌شود. بدان نزدیک و در کنارش حاضر می‌شود (نگا: قصص / 23). البتّه ورودِ مؤمنان تنها جنبه دیدن و عبور بدون اذیّت و آزار است. و ورودِ کافران برای ماندگاری و چشیدن عذاب سرمدی و پیوسته در حال افزایش دوزخ است (نگا: هود / 98، انبیاء / 98). «مَقْضِیّاً»: (نگا: مریم / 21).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و هیچ‌کس از شما نیست مگر آنکه وارد آن خواهد شد، این امر بر پروردگارت قضای حتمی است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و همه شما (بدون استثنا) وارد جهنم می‌شوید؛ این امری است حتمی و قطعی بر پروردگارت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیست از شما جز دراینده آن است بوده است بر پروردگار تو بایسته‌ای گذرانیده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هيچ كس از شما نيست مگر آنكه به آن در آيد- يا بر آن بگذرد- اين [حكم و وعده‌اى است كه‌] بر پروردگار تو بايسته و گزاردنى- انجام دادنى- است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هیچ کس از شما نیست مگر (اینکه) در آن وارد است. (این) بر عهده‌ی پروردگارت حکمی قطعی بوده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: There is not one among you who will not reach it. Your Lord has made this incumbent on Himself.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And there is none among you who shall not pass over hell; this is an obligatory affair, binding upon your Lord. (Allah will make everyone pass over the back of hell – on a thin bridge.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Not one of you there is, but he shall go down to it; that for thy Lord is a thing decreed, determined.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And not one of you but shall pass over it: it is for thy Lord an ordinance decreed. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: There is not one of you but will pass over it (Hell); this is with your Lord; a Decree which must be accomplished.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: There is not one of you but will go down to it. This has been an unavoidable decree of your Lord.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: There is not one of you but shall pass by Hell. This is a decree which your Lord will fulfil.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: There is not one of you but will pass over it (Hell); this is with your Lord, a decree which must be accomplished.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: There is not one of you but shall approach it. That is a fixed ordinance of thy Lord.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There is none of you but will come to it: a [matter that is a] decided certainty with your Lord.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: There is not one of you who shall not go down to it: such is a thing decreed, determined by your Lord.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is the inevitable decree of your Lord that every one of you will be taken to hell.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And there is not one of you but shall come to it; this is an unavoidable decree of your Lord.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wain minkum illa wariduha kana AAala rabbika hatman maqdiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and there is not one of you but shall pass through it: a decree from your Lord which must be fulfilled.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Not one of you but will pass over it: this is, with thy Lord, a Decree which must be accomplished.

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ نُنَجِّي‌ الَّذِينَ‌ اتَّقَوْا وَ نَذَرُ الظَّالِمِينَ‌ فِيهَا جِثِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس آنان را که [از کفر، شرک، فساد و گناه] پرهیز کردند، نجات می دهیم، و ستمکاران را که به زانو درافتاده اند، در دوزخ رها می کنیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه پرهيزگاران را نجات مى‌دهيم و ستمكاران را همچنان به زانونشسته در آنجا وامى‌گذاريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس كسانى را كه تقوا پيشه كردند نجات مى‌دهيم و ظالمان را به زانو درآمده در آن رها مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه كسانى را كه پرهيزگار بوده‌اند مى‌رهانيم، و ستمگران را به زانو درافتاده در [دوزخ‌] رها مى‌كنيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس از ورود همه در دوزخ، ما افرادی را که خداترس و باتقوا بوده‌اند نجات خواهیم داد و ستمکاران را فرو گذاریم تا در آن آتش به زانو درافتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس پرهیزگاران را نجات می‌دهیم، و ستمگران را ذلیلانه در آن رها می‌سازیم. [[«نَذَرُ»: رها می‌سازیم. «جِثِیّاً»: (نگا: مریم / 68).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس کسانی را که پروا پیشه کرده‌اند، می‌رهانیم و ستم‌پیشگان را در آنجا به زانو درافتاده فرو می‌گذاریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس آنها را که تقوا پیشه کردند از آن رهایی می‌بخشیم؛ و ظالمان را -در حالی که (از ضعف و ذلّت) به زانو درآمده‌اند- در آن رها می‌سازیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس می‌رهانیم آنان را که پرهیزکاری کردند و بگذرایم ستمگران را در آن به زانو درآیندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه كسانى را كه پرهيزگارى كردند برهانيم و ستمكاران را در آنجا به زانو در آمده بگذاريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس کسانی را که پرهیزگاری می‌کرده‌اند می‌رهانیم، و ستمگران را در حالی که به زانو در افتاده‌اند در دوزخ وا می‌گذاریم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We shall deliver those who took heed for themselves, and leave the evil-doers kneeling there.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We shall then rescue the pious – and leave the unjust in it, fallen on their knees.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then We shall deliver those that were godfearing; and the evildoers We shall leave there, hobbling on their knees.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then We shall deliver those who have feared, and shall have the wrong-doers therein kneeling. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then We shall save those who use to fear Allah and were dutiful to Him. And We shall leave the Zalimun (polytheists and wrongdoers, etc.) therein (humbled) to their knees (in Hell).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then We will rescue those who were devout, and leave the wrongdoers in it, on their knees.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then We shall deliver those that feared Allah and leave the wrong-doers there on their knees.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then We shall save those who had Taqwa. And We shall leave the wrongdoers in it, Jithiyya.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then We shall rescue those who kept from evil, and leave the evil-doers crouching there.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then We will deliver those who are Godwary, and leave the wrongdoers in it, fallen on their knees.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then, We will save those who were cautious of Us, but the harmdoers shall be left there hobbling on their knees.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We will save the pious ones from the hell fire and leave the unjust people therein in crowded groups.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We will deliver those who guarded (against evil), and We will leave the unjust therein on their knees.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma nunajjee allatheena ittaqaw wanatharu alththalimeena feeha jithiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then We shall save those who feared God, but the wrongdoers shall be left there on their knees.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But We shall save those who guarded against evil, and We shall leave the wrong-doers therein, (humbled) to their knees.

verses.text: وَ إِذَا تُتْلَى‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ آيَاتُنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ‌ قَالَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا لِلَّذِينَ‌ آمَنُوا أَيُ‌ الْفَرِيقَيْنِ‌ خَيْرٌ مَقَاماً وَ أَحْسَنُ‌ نَدِيّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هنگامی که آیات روشن ما را بر آنان می خوانند، کافران به آنان که ایمان آورده اند، می گویند: کدام یک از ما دو گروه، جایگاهش [از جهت مادی] بهتر و مجلس اُنسش [از لحاظ اجتماعی و سیاسی] نیکوتر است؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون آيات روشنگر ما را بر آنان بخوانند، كافران به مؤمنان مى‌گويند: كدام يك از دو فرقه را جايگاه بهتر و محفل نيكوتر است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون آيات روشن ما بر آنها تلاوت شود، كسانى كه كافر شدند به مؤمنان گويند: كدام يك از ما دو گروه جايگاهش بهتر و محفلش نيكوتر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون آيات روشن ما بر آنان خوانده شود، كسانى كه كفر ورزيده‌اند به آنان كه ايمان آورده‌اند مى‌گويند: «كدام يك از [ما] دو گروه جايگاهش بهتر و محفلش آراسته‌تر است؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هرگاه (در فضیلت مؤمن بر کافر) آیات واضحه ما بر مردم تلاوت شود کافران (غنی و متکبر) به مؤمنان (در مقام مفاخره) گویند: کدام یک از ما دو فرقه مقاماتمان بهتر و مجلس و انجمنمان نیکوتر خواهد بود؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کافران هنگامی که آیات روشن و بیانگر (حقائق) ما بر آنان خوانده می‌شود، به مؤمنان می‌گویند: کدام یک از دو گروه (ما و شما) منزل (زندگی) آنان بهتر، و مجلس (عیش و عشرت) ایشان زیباتر است؟ [[«مَقَاماً»: منزل و مسکن. جایگاه و پایگاه. «نَدِیّاً»: مجلس. باشگاه.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون آیات روشنگر ما بر آنان خوانده شود، کفرپیشگان به مؤمنان گویند، باید دید کدام یک از دو گروه [از ما یا شما] نیکمرتبه‌تر و مجلس‌آراترست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هنگامی که آیات روشن ما بر آنان خوانده می‌شود، کافران به مؤمنان می‌گویند: «کدام یک از دو گروه [= ما و شما] جایگاهش بهتر، و جلسات انس و مشورتش زیباتر، و بخشش او بیشتر است؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر گاه خوانده شود بر ایشان آیتهای ما تابناک گویند آنان که کفر ورزیدند بدانان که ایمان آوردند کدام از دو گروهند بهتر در جایگاه و نکوتر در انجمن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چون آيات روشن ما بر آنان خوانده شود كسانى كه كافر شدند به كسانى كه ايمان آورده‌اند گويند: كداميك از اين دو گروه را جايگاهى بهتر و انجمنى نيكوتر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هنگامی که آیات ما -روشنگرانه- بر آنان خوانده شود، کسانی که کفر ورزیده‌اند، به آنان که ایمان آورده‌اند گویند: «کدام یک از (ما) دو گروه جایگاهش بهتر و جلسه‌ی اُنسش نیکوتر است‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When Our lucid revelations are read out to them, the infidels say to those who believe: "Which of the two groups is better in standing, and whose company is more excellent?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, the disbelievers say to the Muslims, “Which group has a better home, and a better alliance?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: When Our signs are recited to them as clear signs, the unbelievers say to the believers, 'Which of the two parties is better in station, fairer in assembly?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when Our manifest revelations are rehearsed unto them, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: which of the two portions is better in station and goodlier in company? *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And when Our Clear Verses are recited to them, those who disbelieve (the rich and strong among the pagans of Quraish who live a life of luxury) say to those who believe (the weak, poor companions of Prophet Muhammad SAW who have a hard life): "Which of the two groups (i.e. believers and disbelievers) is best in (point of) position and as regards station (place of council for consultation)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, “Which of the two parties is better in position, and superior in influence?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When Our clear revelations are recited to those who deny the Truth they are wont to say to those who have faith: "Which of the two groups has a better status and whose assemblies are grander?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And when Our clear Ayat are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe: "Which of the two groups has the best dwellings and the finest Nadiyyan"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: Which of the two parties (yours or ours) is better in position, and more imposing as an army?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When Our manifest signs are recited to them, the faithless say to the faithful, ‘Which of the two groups is superior in station and better with respect to company?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When Our clear verses are recited to them the unbelievers say to the believers: 'Which of the two parties has a better position or company'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When Our revelations are recited to them, the unbelievers say to the faithful ones, "Which of us is more prosperous?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And when Our clear communications are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe: Which of the two parties is best in abiding and best in assembly?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waitha tutla AAalayhim ayatuna bayyinatin qala allatheena kafaroo lillatheena amanoo ayyu alfareeqayni khayrun maqaman waahsanu nadiyyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, those who deny the truth say to the faithful, "Which of the two sides is better in respect of position and makes a more impressive assembly?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them, the Unbelievers say to those who believe, "Which of the two sides is best in point of position? Which makes the best show in council?"

verses.text: وَ کَمْ‌ أَهْلَکْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ قَرْنٍ‌ هُمْ‌ أَحْسَنُ‌ أَثَاثاً وَ رِئْياً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و چه بسیار اقوامی را پیش از آنان هلاک کردیم که لوازم زندگی بهتر [و منظر] و ظاهری [خوش نماتر و] نیکوتر داشتند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پيش از آنها چه بسا مردمى را به هلاكت رسانيده‌ايم كه از حيث اثاث و منظر بهتر از آنها بودند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چه بسيار اقوامى را پيش از آنها نابود كرديم كه هم ساز و برگى بهتر و هم منظرى نيكوتر داشتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چه بسيار نسلها را پيش از آنان نابود كرديم، كه اثاثى بهتر و ظاهرى فريباتر داشتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در صورتی که ما پیش از این کافران چه گروه‌های بسیاری را که از اینها داراتر و خوشتر بودند همه را هلاک گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما اقوام بیشماری را نابود کرده‌ایم که پیش از آنان (در روزگاران کهن) می‌زیسته‌اند و از اینان، مال و ثروت و وسائل زندگی بهتری داشته‌اند و هم ظاهر و هیئت و سیمایشان آراسته‌تر و پیراسته‌تر بوده است. [[«کَمْ»: چه زیاد. بسیار فراوان. «قَرْنٍ»: مردمان همعصر و همزمان (نگا: انعام / 6). «أَثَاثاً»: کالای منزل. وسائل زندگی. «رِئْیاً»: سیما و دیدار. هیئت و منظره.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چه بسیار پیش از آنان نسلهایی را که خوش‌ساز و برگ‌تر و خوش‌نماتر بودند، نابود کردیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چه بسیار اقوامی را پیش از آنان نابود کردیم که هم مال و ثروتشان از آنها بهتر بود، و هم ظاهرشان آراسته‌تر!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بسا نابود کردیم پیش از ایشان از قرنهائی که نکوتر بودند در ابزار (کالاها) و در منظر

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چه بسا گروه‌ها را كه پيش از آنان هلاك كرديم كه به كالاى خانه و به ديدار- هيئت و منظر- [از اينها] نيكوتر بودند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چه بسیار نسل‌ها را پیش از آنان نابود کردیم، (که) آنها اثاثی نیکوتر و ظاهری فریباتر داشتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: How many generations that had far more wealth and ostentation have We laid low before them!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And many a generation We did destroy before them, who exceeded them in wealth and pomp!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And how many a generation We destroyed before them, who were fairer in furnishing and outward show!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And how many a generation have We destroyed before these, who were goodlier in goods and outward appearance? *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And how many a generation (past nations) have We destroyed before them, who were better in wealth, goods and outward appearance?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, who surpassed them in riches and splendor?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: How numerous are the peoples We destroyed before them - those that were more resourceful and grander in outward appearance!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were better in wealth, goods and outward appearance

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were more imposing in respect of gear and outward seeming!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: How many a generation We have destroyed before them, who were superior in furnishings and appearance!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: How many generations have We destroyed before them, who were far greater in riches and more boastful!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: How many generations of greater prosperity and splendor have We destroyed before them?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And how many of the generations have We destroyed before them who were better in respect of goods and outward appearance!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wakam ahlakna qablahum min qarnin hum ahsanu athathan wariyan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have destroyed so many generations before them, who surpassed them in material power and splendour.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But how many (countless) generations before them have we destroyed, who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the eye?

verses.text: قُلْ‌ مَنْ‌ کَانَ‌ فِي‌ الضَّلاَلَةِ فَلْيَمْدُدْ لَهُ‌ الرَّحْمٰنُ‌ مَدّاً حَتَّى‌ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ‌ إِمَّا الْعَذَابَ‌ وَ إِمَّا السَّاعَةَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ‌ مَنْ‌ هُوَ شَرٌّ مَکَاناً وَ أَضْعَفُ‌ جُنْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: آنان که در گمراهی قرار دارند، باید [خدای] رحمان [بر پایه سنت جاری خود] به آنان مهلتی معین دهد، تا زمانی که آنچه را به آنان وعده داده اند ببینند، یا عقوبت و شکنجه [در دنیا] را یا عذاب قیامت را؛ پس به زودی خواهند دانست چه کسی جایگاهش بدتر و سپاهش ناتوان تر است؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: هر كس كه در گمراهى باشد، خداى رحمان او را به فزونى مدد مى‌رساند، تا آنگاه آنچه را به او وعده داده شده است بنگرد: يا عذاب و يا قيامت. آنگاه خواهند دانست كه چه كسى را جايگاه بدتر و سپاه ناتوان‌تر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: هر كه در ضلالت باشد، بايد خداى رحمان او را تا زمانى مهلت و بهره دهد، تا وقتى كه آنچه را به آنها وعده داده مى‌شود با چشم خود ببينند، يا عذاب [اين دنيا] يا قيامت را، و آن روز خواهند دانست چه كسى جايش بدتر و سپاهش ناتوان‌تر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «هر كه در گمراهى است [خداى‌] رحمان به او تا زمانى مهلت مى‌دهد، تا وقتى آنچه به آنان وعده داده مى‌شود: يا عذاب، يا روز رستاخيز را ببينند؛ پس به زودى خواهند دانست جايگاه چه كسى بدتر و سپاهش ناتوان‌تر است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو که هر کس که به راه کفر و ضلالت رفت خدای مهربان به او مهلت می‌دهد تا آن ساعت که وعده عذاب را به چشم خود ببینند که یا عذاب (قتل و اسیری) چشد یا ساعت قیامت وی را فرا رسد، پس کافران به زودی خواهند دانست که (از مؤمن و کافر) کدام یک روزگارش بدتر و سپاهش ضعیف‌تر است!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای پیغمبر!) بگو: کسانی که در گمراهی هستند (و اصرار بر ادامه‌ی این راه دارند) خداوند مهربان بدیشان مهلت می‌دهد (تا بر کفر و طغیان خود بیفزایند و بیشتر در گناه فرو بروند) تا آن گاه که می‌بینند آنچه را بدان وعده داده شده‌اند، چه عذاب (کافران توسّط جهادگران مسلمان) را، و چه (خواری و رسوائی) آخرت را. بالأخره ایشان خواهند دانست که چه کسی مسکن و منزلش بدتر و سپاه و لشکرش ضعیف‌تر و ناتوانتر است. [[«فَلْیَمْدُدْ لَهُ الرَّحْمنُ مَدّاً»: بگذار خداوند مهربان به طریق استدراج بدیشان مهلت دهد. جمله طلبی است در معنی خبری. یعنی: خداوند مهربان بدیشان مهلت می‌دهد. «إِمَّا الْعَذابَ وَ إِمَّا السَّاعَةَ»: چه عذاب دنیوی و چه عذاب اخروی. واژه (الْعَذابَ) و (السّاعَةَ) بدل از (ما) است. «جُنداً»: لشکر. لشکریان. مراد دسته و گروه و یاران و مددکاران است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو هرکس که ضلالت را برگزیند، خداوند رحمان [از روی استدراج‌] به او افزونی بخشد تا آنکه آنچه به ایشان وعده داده‌اند، چه عذاب [الهی‌]، چه قیام قیامت ببینند، و زودا خواهند دانست که چه کسی بدمرتبه‌تر و سست نیروتر است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «کسی که در گمراهی است، باید خداوند به او مهلت دهد تا زمانی که وعده الهی را با چشم خود ببینند: یا عذاب (این دنیا)، یا (عذاب) قیامت! (آن روز) خواهند دانست چه کسی جایش بدتر، و لشکرش ناتوانتر است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو آنکه در گمراهی است پس باید مهلت دهد بدو خداوند مهربان مهلتی تا گاهی که بینند آنچه را وعده داده شوند یا شکنجه و یا ساعت را زود است بدانند کیست آنکه بدتر است در جایگاه و سست‌تر است در سپاه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: هر كه در گمراهى باشد، پس خداى رحمان بايد كه او را فزونى دهد- به او مهلت دهد تا گمراهى‌اش بيشتر شود- تا آنگاه كه آنچه را به آنان وعده داده مى‌شود ببينند: يا عذاب [اين جهانى‌] را- مانند كشته يا اسير شدن- و يا رستاخيز را پس زودا كه بدانند چه كسى را جايگاهى بدتر و سپاهى ناتوان‌تر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «هر کس در (ژرفای) گمراهی بوده است، پس باید (خدای) رحمان به او تا زمانی مهلت دهد، تا هنگامی که آنچه به آنان وعده داده می‌شود ببینند، یا عذاب را، یا ساعت [:قیامت] را. پس به زودی خواهند دانست جایگاه چه کسی بدتر و سپاهش ناتوان‌تر است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "Ar-Rahman extends the life of those who are astray until they come to realise what had been promised them was either (physical) affliction or (the terror) of Resurrection. Then will they know who is worse in position, and who is weak in supporters.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim, “For one in error – so the Most Gracious may give him respite; to the extent that when they see the thing which they are promised – either the punishment or the Last Day; so then they will come to know for whom is the evil rank and whose army is weak.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'Whosoever is in error, let the All-merciful prolong his term for him! Till, when they see that they were threatened, whether the chastisement, or the Hour, then they shall surely know who is worse in place, and who is weaker in hosts.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: whosoever is in error--surely unto him the Compassionate lengtheneth a length, until When they behold that wherewith they were threatened, either the torment or the Hour, then they shall come to know whosoever is worse in position and weaker as an army. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW) whoever is in error, the Most Beneficent (Allah) will extend (the rope) to him, until, when they see that which they were promised, either the torment or the Hour, they will come to know who is worst in position, and who is weaker in forces. [This is the answer for the Verse No. 19:73]

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “Whoever is in error, the Most Merciful will lead him on.” Until, when they see what they were promised—either the punishment, or the Hour. Then they will know who was in worse position and weaker in forces.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say: "The Most Compassionate Lord grants respite to those who stray into error, until they behold what they had been threatened with, either God's chastisement (in the world) or the Hour (of Resurrection)" - then they fully know whose station is worse, and who is weaker in hosts!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: whoever is in error, the Most Gracious will extend [circumstances] for him, until, when they see that which they were promised, either the torment or the Hour, they will come to know who is worst in position, and who is weaker in forces.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: As for him who is in error, the Beneficent will verily prolong his span of life until, when they behold that which they were promised, whether it be punishment (in the world), or the Hour (of doom), they will know who is worse in position and who is weaker as an army.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘Whoever abides in error, the All-beneficent shall prolong his respite until they sight what they have been promised: either punishment, or the Hour.’ Then they will know whose position is worse, and whose host is weaker.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'Whosoever is in error, let the Most Merciful prolong his life span until they see that which they were threatened, be it a punishment, or the Hour. Thenshall they know whose is the worst place and who is weaker in hosts'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), tell them, "The Beneficent God gives respite to those who have gone astray only until they face the torment with which they were threatened or to the Day of Judgment. Then they will find out who will have the most miserable place and the weakest forces.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: As for him who remains in error, the Beneficent Allah will surely prolong his length of days, until they see what they were threatened with, either the punishment or the hour; then they shall know who is in more evil plight and weaker in forces

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul man kana fee alddalalati falyamdud lahu alrrahmanu maddan hatta itha raaw ma yooAAadoona imma alAAathaba waimma alssaAAata fasayaAAlamoona man huwa sharrun makanan waadAAafu jundan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "The Gracious One grants respite for a time to those who are in error until, when they are confronted with what they are promised, either in punishment [in the world] or in [the approach of] the Hour, they will realize who is worse in respect of position and who is weaker in resources."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "If any men go astray, (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them, until, when they see the warning of Allah (being fulfilled) - either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour,- they will at length realise who is worst in position, and (who) weakest in forces!

verses.text: وَ يَزِيدُ اللَّهُ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ اهْتَدَوْا هُدًى‌ وَ الْبَاقِيَاتُ‌ الصَّالِحَاتُ‌ خَيْرٌ عِنْدَ رَبِّکَ‌ ثَوَاباً وَ خَيْرٌ مَرَدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آنان که هدایت یافته اند، خدا بر هدایتشان می افزاید، و اعمال شایسته پایدار نزد پروردگارت از جهت پاداش بهتر و از لحاظ بازدهی نیکوتر است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و خدا بر هدايت آنان كه هدايت يافته‌اند خواهد افزود و نزد پروردگار تو پاداش و نتيجه كردارهاى شايسته‌اى كه باقى‌ماندنى‌اند بهتر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و خداوند بر هدايت كسانى كه هدايت را پذيرفتند، مى‌افزايد. و نيكى‌هاى ماندگار در پيشگاه پروردگارت از نظر پاداش و عاقبت بهتر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و خداوند كسانى را كه هدايت يافته‌اند بر هدايتشان مى‌افزايد، و نيكيهاى ماندگار، نزد پروردگارت از حيث پاداش بهتر و خوش‌فرجام‌تر است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خدا هدایت یافتگان را بر هدایت می‌افزاید و اعمال صالحی که (اجرش نعمت) ابدی است نزد پروردگار تو بهتر (از مال و جاه فانی دنیا) است هم از جهت ثواب الهی و هم از جهت حسن عاقبت اخروی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (این عاقبت و سرنوشت ستمگران و فریفتگان دنیا بود، و امّا) کسانی که در راه هدایت گام برداشته‌اند، خداوند بر هدایت ایشان می‌افزاید (و در راه انجام کارهای خوب و شایسته توفیق نصیبشان می‌گرداند) و (معلوم است که) آثار و اعمال نیکوئی که (از انسان می‌ماند و) در پیشگاه پروردگارت ذخیره می‌گردد، از لحاظ اجر و پاداش و از نظر عاقبت خوبتر و مفیدتر است. [[«هُدیً»: هدایت و رهنمود. مفعول‌به است. «مَرَدّاً»: مصدر میمی و به معنی بازگشت، یا این که اسم مکان و به معنی محلّ بازگشت است که مراد در اینجا بهشت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و خداوند بر هدایت رهیافتگان بیفزاید و کارهای ماندگار شایسته در نزد پروردگارت خوش پاداش‌تر و خوش عاقبت‌تر است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (امّا) کسانی که در راه هدایت گام نهادند، خداوند بر هدایتشان می‌افزاید؛ و آثار شایسته‌ای که (از انسان) باقی می‌ماند، ثوابش در پیشگاه پروردگارت بهتر، و عاقبتش خوبتر است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بیفزاید خدا آنان را که پی‌جوی هدایتند هدایت را و بازمانده‌های شایسته بهتر است نزد پروردگار تو در پاداش و بهتر است در بازگشت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خداوند كسانى را كه راه راست يافتند رهنمونى همى‌افزايد، و ماندگارهاى نيك و شايسته نزد پروردگار تو پاداشى بهتر و بازگشت و سرانجامى بهتر دارد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و خدا کسانی را که هدایت‌یافته‌اند بر هدایتشان می‌افزاید. و ماندنی‌های شایسته(ی ایمان)، نزد پروردگارت از حیث پاداش بهتر و بازگشتشان خوبتر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: God gives greater guidance to those who are guided; and good deeds that endure are better with your Lord for reward, and better for consequence.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And Allah will increase the guidance for those who have received guidance; and good deeds that remain have the best reward before your Lord, and the best outcome.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And God shall increase those who were guided in guidance; and the abiding things, the deeds of righteousness, are better with thy Lord in reward, and better in return

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Allah increaseth in guidance those who let themselves be guided, and the righteous works that last are excellent with thy Lord in respect of reward and excellent in respect of return. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Allah increases in guidance those who walk aright [true believers in the Oneness of Allah who fear Allah much (abstain from all kinds of sins and evil deeds which He has forbidden), and love Allah much (perform all kinds of good deeds which He has ordained)]. And the righteous good deeds that last, are better with your Lord, for reward and better for resort.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: God increases in guidance those who accept guidance. And the things that endure—the righteous deeds—have the best reward with your Lord, and the best outcome.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (On the contrary), Allah increases in guidance those who follow the Right Way. Lasting acts of righteousness are better in the sight of your Lord as reward and conducive to a better end.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And Allah increases in guidance those who walk aright. And the righteous good deeds that last are better with your Lord for reward and better for resort.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Allah increaseth in right guidance those who walk aright, and the good deeds which endure are better in thy Lord's sight for reward, and better for resort.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Allah enhances in guidance those who are [rightly] guided, and lasting righteous deeds are better with your Lord in reward, and better at the return [to Allah].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Allah will increase those who were guided in guidance and things that abide. Good deeds are better in reward with your Lord, and, better in return.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God further enlightens those who seek guidance. To those who do charitable deeds which produce continuing benefits, your Lord will give a better reward and a better place in Paradise.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Allah increases in guidance those who go aright; and ever-abiding good works are with your Lord best in recompense and best in yielding fruit.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wayazeedu Allahu allatheena ihtadaw hudan waalbaqiyatu alssalihatu khayrun AAinda rabbika thawaban wakhayrun maraddan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God increases His guidance to those who follow guidance; and lasting good works are better in the sight of your Lord and are most rewarding.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And Allah doth advance in guidance those who seek guidance: and the things that endure, Good Deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best in respect of (their) eventual return."

verses.text: أَ فَرَأَيْتَ‌ الَّذِي‌ کَفَرَ بِآيَاتِنَا وَ قَالَ‌ لَأُوتَيَنَ‌ مَالاً وَ وَلَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا دیدی آن کسی را که به آیات ما کافر شد وگفت: [به خاطر انتخاب آیین شرک و کفر] به من مال و اولاد بسیار خواهند داد؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آن كسى را كه به آيات ما كافر بود ديدى كه مى‌گفت: البته به من مال و فرزند داده خواهد شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا ديدى آن كسى را كه به آيات ما كفر ورزيد و گفت: قطعا به من مال و فرزند بسيار داده خواهد شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا ديدى آن كسى را كه به آيات ما كفر ورزيد و گفت: «قطعاً به من مال و فرزند [بسيار] داده خواهد شد»؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول) دیدی حال آن کس را که به آیات ما کافر شد (مانند عاص بن وائل کافر) و (به خبّاب بن ارت مؤمن به استهزاء و مسخره) گفت: من البته مال و فرزند بسیار (در بهشت هم) خواهم داشت (و آنجا طلب تو را می‌دهم)؟!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا در شگفت نیستی از آن کسی که آیات ما را انکار کرده و می‌گوید: (اگر قیامتی هم به فرض باشد، در آنجا) بدون شکّ دارائی فراوان و فرزندان زیادی به من داده خواهد شد؟! (و در آنجا هم از شما جلوتر و از خوشی و لذائذ بیشتری بهره‌مند خواهم شد). [[«أَفَرَأَیْتَ»: (نگا: بقره / 243، انعام / 46). «لأُوتَیَنَّ»: حتماً و قطعاً به من داده خواهد شد. از مصدر (ایتآء). «مالاً وَ وَلَداً»: تنوین برای تکثیر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا ننگریسته‌ای کسی را که به آیات ما کفر [و انکار]ورزید و ادعا کرد که به من مال و فرزند داده خواهد شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا دیدی کسی را که به آیات ما کافر شد، و گفت: «اموال و فرزندان فراوانی به من داده خواهد شد»؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا دیده‌ای آن را که کفر ورزید به آیتهای ما و گفت هر آینه داده شوم مال و فرزندی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا ديدى آن كس را كه به آيات ما كافر شد و گفت: البته به من مال و فرزند داده شود؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس آیا دیدی کسی را که به آیات ما کفر ورزید؟ و گفت: «هر آینه بی‌گمان به من مال و فرزندی (بسیار) داده خواهد شد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Have you seen him who denies Our revelations, and says: "I will certainly be given wealth and children."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So have you seen him who denied Our signs and says, “I shall certainly be given wealth and children?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Hast thou seen him who disbelieves in Our signs and says, 'Assuredly I shall be given wealth and children'?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Hast thou observed him who disbelieveth in Our signs and saith: surely I shall be vouchsafed riches and children. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Have you seen him who disbelieved in Our Ayat (this Quran and Muhammad SAW) and (yet) says: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children [if I will be alive (again)],"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Have you seen him who denied Our revelations, and said, “I will be given wealth and children”?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Have you seen him who rejected Our signs and said: "Surely I shall continue to be favoured with riches and children."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Have you seen him who disbelieved in Our Ayat and said: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children [if I live again]."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Hast thou seen him who disbelieveth in Our revelations and saith: Assuredly I shall be given wealth and children?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Have you not regarded him who defies Our signs, and says, ‘I will surely be given wealth and children’?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have you seen he who disbelieves Our verses and yet says: 'I shall surely be given wealth and children'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Note the words of the disbeliever, "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Have you, then, seen him who disbelieves in Our communications and says: I shall certainly be given wealth and children?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afaraayta allathee kafara biayatina waqala laootayanna malan wawaladan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have you seen him who denies the truth in Our revelations and says, "I shall certainly be given wealth and children."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Hast thou then seen the (sort of) man who rejects Our Signs, yet says: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"

verses.text: أَطَّلَعَ‌ الْغَيْبَ‌ أَمِ‌ اتَّخَذَ عِنْدَ الرَّحْمٰنِ‌ عَهْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا [او درباره رسیدن به مال و اولاد بسیار] بر غیب آگاهی یافته، یا پیمانی [بر این عطای فراوان] از سوی [خدای] رحمان دریافت نموده است؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا از غيب آگاهى داشت، يا از خداى رحمان پيمان گرفته بود؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا از غيب خبر يافته يا نزد خداى رحمان پيمانى گرفته است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا بر غيب آگاه شده يا از [خداى‌] رحمان عهدى گرفته است؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا بر عالم غیب آگاهی یافته یا از خدای رحمن (بر خود) عهدی گرفته است (که در عالم آخرت هم دارای نعمت و ثروت باشد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا او از (اَسرار) غیب آگاه شده است؟ و یا (این که در این زمینه) از پیشگاه خدای مهربان عهد و پیمانی گرفته است؟ [[«أَطَّلَعَ»: آیا آگاه شده است؟ آیا اطّلاع پیدا کرده است؟ این واژه فراهم آمده است از (أَ) که حرف استفهام است و مراد از آن تعجّب است و (إِطَّلَعَ) فعل ماضی باب افتعال.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا از غیب اطلاع داشت، یا از خدای رحمان پیمانی [خاص‌] گرفته بود؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا او از غیب آگاه گشته، یا نزد خدا عهد و پیمانی گرفته است؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا آگهی یافت بر ناپیدا یا برگرفته است نزد خدای مهربان عهدی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا بر غيب آگاهى يافته يا از نزد خداى رحمان پيمانى گرفته؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا بر غیب آگاه شده، یا نزد (خدای) رحمان پیمانی بر گرفته است‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Has he peeped into the Unknown, or obtained a promise from Ar-Rahman?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Has he seen the Hidden, or has he made a pact with the Most Gracious?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, has he observed the Unseen, or taken a covenant with the All-merciful?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Hath he looked unto the Unseen, or hath he taken of the Compassionate a covenant? *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Has he known the unseen or has he taken a covenant from the Most Beneficent (Allah)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Did he look into the future, or did he receive a promise from the Most Merciful?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Has he obtained knowledge of the Unseen, or has he taken a covenant with the Most Compassionate Lord?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Has he known the Unseen or has he taken a covenant from the Most Gracious

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Hath he perused the Unseen, or hath he made a pact with the Beneficent?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Has he come to know the Unseen, or taken a promise from the All-beneficent?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Has he gained knowledge of the Unseen? Or taken a covenant with the Merciful?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Has he the knowledge of the unseen or has the Beneficent God established such a binding agreement with Him?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Has he gained knowledge of the unseen, or made a covenant with the Beneficent Allah?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AttalaAAa alghayba ami ittakhatha AAinda alrrahmani AAahdan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Has he looked to the unseen, or has he made a pledge to the Merciful One?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Has he penetrated to the Unseen, or has he taken a contract with (Allah) Most Gracious?

verses.text: کَلاَّ سَنَکْتُبُ‌ مَا يَقُولُ‌ وَ نَمُدُّ لَهُ‌ مِنَ‌ الْعَذَابِ‌ مَدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این چنین نیست [که او می گوید]، ما به زودی آنچه را می گوید [در پرونده عملش] خواهیم نوشت و عذابش را همواره ادامه خواهیم داد.
