translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه چنين است. آنچه مى‌گويد خواهيم نوشت و البته بر عذابش خواهيم افزود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چنين نيست، آنچه را مى‌گويد خواهيم نوشت و عذابش را تداوم خواهيم داد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نه چنين است. به زودى آنچه را مى‌گويد، مى‌نويسيم و عذاب را براى او خواهيم افزود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: هرگز چنین نیست، ما البته آنچه گوید خواهیم نوشت و سخت بر عذابش خواهیم افزود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چنین نیست که او می‌گوید. ما آنچه را که می‌گوید (علیه او) می‌نویسیم، و عذاب را بر او مستمرّ و پیاپی خواهیم داشت. [[«کَلاّ»: نه چنین است. حرف ردع و انکار است و سخن گوینده ماقبل را باطل می‌گرداند و او را از کاری که کرده است باز می‌دارد. «نَمُدُّ»: طول می‌دهیم. مستمرّ و پیاپی می‌کنیم. افزایش می‌دهیم و مضاعف می‌گردانیم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چنین نیست، گفته‌اش را باز می‌نویسیم و به عذاب او می‌افزاییم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگز چنین نیست! ما بزودی آنچه را می‌گوید می‌نویسیم و عذاب را بر او مستمرّ خواهیم داشت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه چنین است زود است بنویسیم آنچه را گوید و کِشش دهیم در عذاب برای او کششی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نه چنان است آنچه مى‌گويد خواهيم نوشت و عذاب او را پيوسته مى‌افزاييم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هرگز! (چنان نیست). به زودی آنچه را می‌گوید، ثبت و ضبط می‌کنیم. و برخی از عذاب را برای او امتدادی مستمر خواهیم داد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Never so. We shall certainly write down what he says, and prolong the extent of his punishment.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Never; We shall now record what he says and give him a prolonged punishment.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: No, indeed! We shall assuredly write down all that he says, and We shall prolong for him the chastisement;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By no means! We shall write down that which he saith; and We shall lengthen for him of the torment a length. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall increase his torment (in the Hell);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: No indeed! We will write what he says, and will keep extending the agony for him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: By no means! We shall write down all what he says; and We shall greatly prolong his chastisement,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay, We shall record what he says, and We shall increase his torment;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but We shall record that which he saith and prolong for him a span of torment.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No indeed! We will write down what he says, and We will prolong his punishment endlessly.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On the contrary, We will write down what he says and prolong the length of his punishment.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Absolutely not, We will record his words and prolong his punishment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: By no means! We write down what he says, and We will lengthen to him the length of the chastisement

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kalla sanaktubu ma yaqoolu wanamuddu lahu mina alAAathabi maddan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Indeed not. We shall record what he says and shall prolong the punishment for him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall add and add to his punishment.

verses.text: وَ نَرِثُهُ‌ مَا يَقُولُ‌ وَ يَأْتِينَا فَرْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آنچه را که [از مال و فرزند] می گوید، از او به میراث می بریم، و تنها نزد ما خواهد آمد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنچه را كه مى‌گويد از او مى‌ستانيم تا تنها نزد ما بيايد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آنچه را مى‌گويد [از اولاد و امكانات‌] از او به ارث مى‌بريم و نزد ما تنها مى‌آيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آنچه را مى‌گويد، از او به ارث مى‌بريم و تنها به سوى ما خواهد آمد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آنچه (از مال و متاع و فرزند) که (به مفاخرت و غرور دایم) در گفتار داشت ما وارث آن شویم و او بی‌کس و تنها به جانب ما بازآید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (و او را می‌میرانیم) و از او به ارث می‌بریم آنچه را که از آن دم می‌زند (که وجود مال و ولد است، و روز قیامت) تک و تنها پیش ما خواهد آمد (و نه مال و ولد، و نه یاور و پشتیبانی همراه او خواهد بود). [[«نَرِثُهُ مَا یَقُولُ»: مراد این است که او را می‌میرانیم و از دست او می‌گیریم اموال و اولادی را که از آنها صحبت می‌کند. «فَرْداً»: تک و تنها. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و مدعیاتش را میراث می‌بریم و به نزد ما یکه و تنها خواهد آمد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنچه را او می‌گوید (از اموال و فرزندان)، از او به ارث می‌بریم، و به صورت تنها نزد ما خواهد آمد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و ارث بریم از او آنچه را گوید (یا ارث دهیمش آنچه را گوید) و بیاید ما را تنها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنچه را كه مى‌گويد- مال و فرزند- از وى ميراث مى‌بريم و تنها نزد ما مى‌آيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آنچه را می‌گوید، از او به ارث می‌بریم، و سوی ما به تنهایی خواهد آمد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: All that he claims will revert to Us, and he will come before Us all alone.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it is We only Who shall inherit what he says (belongs to him), and he will come to Us, alone.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and We shall inherit from him that he says, and he shall come to Us alone.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We shall inherit from him that whereof he spake, and he shall come to us alone. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We shall inherit from him (at his death) all that he talks of (i.e. wealth and children which We have bestowed upon him in this world), and he shall come to Us alone.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then We will inherit from him what he speaks of, and he will come to Us alone.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We shall inherit all the resources and hosts of which he boasts, and he will come to Us all alone.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We shall inherit from him all that he speaks of, and he shall come to Us alone.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We shall inherit from him that whereof he spake, and he will come unto Us, alone (without his wealth and children).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We shall take over from him what he talks about, and he will come to Us alone.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We shall inherit that of which he speaks and he will come before Us alone.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: All that he speaks of will belong to Us, and he will come into Our presence all alone.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We will inherit of him what he says, and he shall come to Us alone.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanarithuhu ma yaqoolu wayateena fardan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We shall inherit all that he boasts of, and he will come to Us all alone.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To Us shall return all that he talks of and he shall appear before Us bare and alone.

verses.text: وَ اتَّخَذُوا مِنْ‌ دُونِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ آلِهَةً لِيَکُونُوا لَهُمْ‌ عِزّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به جای خدا معبودانی گرفتند تا برای آنان مایه عزت و توانمندی باشد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و به غير از اللّه خدايانى اختيار كردند تا سبب عزتشان گردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به جاى خدا معبودانى اختيار كردند تا سبب عزتشان باشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به جاى خدا، معبودانى اختيار كردند تا براى آنان [مايه‌] عزّت باشد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و مشرکان، خدای یگانه را ترک گفته و خدایان باطل (مانند بتها و فراعنه) را برای عزت و احترام دنیوی برگرفتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (این گونه افراد) بجز خدا، معبودهائی برای خود برگزیده‌اند تا این که چنین معبودهائی مایه‌ی عزّت و احترام (دنیوی و اخروی) ایشان گردند. (در دنیا در رفع مشکلات یاریشان دهند، و در آخرت برایشان شفاعت و میانجیگری کنند). [[«عِزّاً»: مصدر است و برای مفرد و مثنّی و جمع و مذکّر و مؤنّث یکسان به کار می‌رود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به جای خداوند خدایانی را به پرستش گرفتند که مایه عزت و اعتبار آنان باشد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آنان غیر از خدا، معبودانی را برای خود برگزیدند تا مایه عزّتشان باشد! (چه پندار خامی!)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برگرفتند جز خدا خدایانی تا باشند برای آنان عزّتی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بجز خداى يكتا خدايانى گرفتند تا آنها را مايه بزرگى و نيرو باشند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بجز خدا، معبودانی برگرفتند، تا برای آنان (مایه‌ی) عزت باشند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They have taken other gods apart from God that they might be a strength to them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they have chosen Gods besides Allah, so that they may provide them strength!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And they have taken to them other gods apart from God, that they might be for them a might.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they have taken gods beside Allah that they might be unto them a glory. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they have taken (for worship) aliha (gods) besides Allah, that they might give them honour, power and glory (and also protect them from Allah's Punishment etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they took, besides God, other gods, to be for them a source of strength.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They have taken other gods instead of Allah that they may be a source of strength for them.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they have taken gods besides Allah, that they might give them honor, power and glory.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they have chosen (other) gods beside Allah that they may be a power for them.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They have taken gods besides Allah that they may be a [source of] might to them.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And they have taken gods, other than Allah, that they might be a power from them.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They have sought honor from other gods instead of God.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they have taken gods besides Allah, that they should be to them a source of strength;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waittakhathoo min dooni Allahi alihatan liyakoonoo lahum AAizzan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They have taken other deities besides God, so that they may be a source of strength for them.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And they have taken (for worship) gods other than Allah, to give them power and glory!

verses.text: کَلاَّ سَيَکْفُرُونَ‌ بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ‌ وَ يَکُونُونَ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ ضِدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: چنین نیست، به زودی [آن معبودان] پرستش آنان را انکار می کنند و دشمنشان خواهند شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه چنين است. به زودى عبادتشان را انكار كنند و به مخالفتشان برخيزند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چنين نيست زودا كه [آن معبودان‌] عبادت ايشان را انكار كنند و مخالف آنها شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نه چنين است. به زودى [آن معبودان‌] عبادت ايشان را انكار مى‌كنند و دشمن آنان مى‌گردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چنین نیست، بلکه به زودی پرستش آن خدایان باطل را انکار کنند و به خصومت آنها برخیزند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نه چنین است (که می‌اندیشند. روز قیامت) معبودهائی را که می‌پرستند، عبادت ایشان را انکار خواهند کرد، و دشمن آنان خواهند شد. [[«سَیَکْفُرُونَ»: بیزاری خواهند جُست. منکرخواهند شد (نگا: نحل / 86، عنکبوت / 25، احقاف / 6). «ضدّاً»: حال مؤکّده (عَلَیْهِمْ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چنین نیست، زودا که [آن خدایان‌] پرستش ایشان را انکار کنند و مخالف آنان باشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگز چنین نیست! به زودی (معبودها) منکر عبادت آنان خواهند شد؛ (بلکه) بر ضدّشان قیام می‌کنند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه چنین است زود است کفر ورزند به پرستش ایشان و باشند برای ایشان برابری (ضدّی)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نه چنان است زودا كه پرستش آنان را انكار كنند و مخالف و دشمنشان باشند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هرگز نه چنان است. به زودی (آن معبودان) عبادت ایشان را انکار (و‌انگار) می‌کنند، و بر ضدّشان خواهند بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Never. They will deny their devotion and become their adversaries.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Never; soon they will deny ever worshipping them, and will turn into their opponents.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: No, indeed! They shall deny their service, and they shall be against them pitted.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By no means! anon they shall deny their worship, and become unto them an adversary. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay, but they (the so-called gods) will deny their worship of them, and become opponents to them (on the Day of Resurrection).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: By no means! They will reject their worship of them, and become opponents to them.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: By no means! They shall soon deny their worship and shall become their adversaries instead.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay, but they will deny their worship of them, and will become their adversaries.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but they will deny their worship of them, and become opponents unto them.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No Indeed! Soon they will disown their worship, and they will be their opponents.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed no! They will renounce their worship and turn against them.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No! Those "gods" will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In fact, they can have no honor; their gods will renounce their worship of idols and will turn against them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: By no means! They shall soon deny their worshipping them, and they shall be adversaries to them.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kalla sayakfuroona biAAibadatihim wayakoonoona AAalayhim diddan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But they shall reject their worship and turn against them.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.

verses.text: أَ لَمْ‌ تَرَ أَنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا الشَّيَاطِينَ‌ عَلَى‌ الْکَافِرِينَ‌ تَؤُزُّهُمْ‌ أَزّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا ندانسته ای که ما شیطان ها را بر کافران فرستادیم تا آنان را به شدت به سوی گناهان و شهوات برانگیزند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا نديده‌اى كه ما شياطين را به سوى كافران فرستاديم تا آنها را برانگيزند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا ندانستى كه ما شياطين را بر كافران فرستاديم تا آنها را [با وسوسه‌ها] شديدا تحريك كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا ندانستى كه ما شيطانها را بر كافران گماشته‌ايم، تا آنان را [به گناهان‌] تحريك كنند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا ندیدی که ما شیاطین را بر سر کافران فرستادیم تا سخت آنها را تحریک کنند (و به وهم و خیالات باطل دنیا آنان را به گناه اندازند و از سعادت ابد محرومشان سازند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نمی‌دانی که ما شیاطین را به سوی کافران فرستاده‌ایم تا آنان را (در انجام گناهان) سخت برانگیزند و بیاغالانند. [[«تَؤُزُّهُمْ»: تکان دهند و بجنبانند. مراد تحریک و تشویق بر معاصی است (نگا: فصّلت / 25). «أَزّاً»: برانگیختن. سخت تکان دادن. به جوش آوردن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا ندانسته‌ای که ما شیاطین را به سراغ کافران می‌فرستیم که از راه به درشان برند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا ندیدی که ما شیاطین را بسوی کافران فرستادیم تا آنان را شدیداً تحریک کنند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا ندیدی که ما فرستادیم شیاطین را بر کافران تا بیازارندشان آزردنی (یا برانگیزندشان انگیختنی)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا نديده‌اى- ندانسته‌اى- كه ما شياطين را بر كافران مى‌فرستيم تا آنها را [به وسوسه به سوى بديها و گناهان‌] سخت بجنبانند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا ندیدی که همواره ما شیطان‌ها را بر (سر و سامان) کافران فرستادیم، حال آنکه آنان را به جنبش و جوشش می‌آوردند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do you not see that We have set the devils against the infidels to rouse and instigate them?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Did you not see that We sent devils upon the disbelievers, so they excite them abundantly?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Hast thou not seen how We sent the Satans against the unbelievers, to prick them?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Beholdest thou not that We have sent the satans upon the infidels inciting them by an incitement? *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: See you not that We have sent the Shayatin (devils) against the disbelievers to push them to do evil.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Have you not considered how We dispatch the devils against the disbelievers, exciting them with incitement?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do you not see that We have sent devils upon the unbelievers who greatly incite them (to oppose the Truth)?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: See you not that We have sent the Shayatin against the disbelievers to push them to do evil.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Seest thou not that We have set the devils on the disbelievers to confound them with confusion?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Have you not regarded that We unleash the devils upon the faithless to urge them vigorously?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Have you not seen how We send down to the unbelievers satans who prick them?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to [evil] with [constant] incitement?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you not realize that We have sent Satan to incite the unbelievers to sin.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Do you not see that We have sent the Shaitans against the unbelievers, inciting them by incitement?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alam tara anna arsalna alshshayateena AAala alkafireena taozzuhum azzan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do you not see that We have appointed devils to incite those who deny the truth to disobedience?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the unbelievers, to incite them with fury?

verses.text: فَلاَ تَعْجَلْ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ إِنَّمَا نَعُدُّ لَهُمْ‌ عَدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بنابراین بر [شکست و هلاکت] آنان شتاب مکن، ما [همه اعمال و رفتار حتی لحظات عمرشان را] به دقت شماره می کنیم [تا مهلتشان تمام شود و به کیفر آنچه همواره مرتکب می شدند، برسند.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس تو بر آنان شتاب مكن كه ما روزهايشان را به دقت مى‌شماريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس بر [عذاب‌] آنها شتاب مكن، ما براى آنها دقيقا روز شمارى مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس بر ضد آنان شتاب مكن، كه ما [روزها] را براى آنها شماره مى‌كنيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس تعجیل در کار آنها مکن که ما حساب (روز و ساعت عذاب) آنان را کاملا در نظر داریم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای پیغمبر! از کفر ایشان دلتنگ مباش، و در نزول عذاب) بر آنان شتاب مکن. ما تمام اعمال ایشان را دقیقاً محاسبه می‌کنیم (و جزای کارهایشان را خواهیم داد). [[«نَعُدُّ»: می‌شماریم. حساب می‌کنیم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در کارشان شتاب مکن، ما حساب کارشان را داریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس درباره آنان شتاب مکن؛ ما آنها (و اعمالشان) را به دقت شماره میکنیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس مشتاب بر ایشان جز این نیست که می‌شماریم برای ایشان (شمردنی)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس بر آنان شتاب مكن- در فرود آمدن عذاب- جز اين نيست كه ما براى آنها به دقت مى‌شماريم- روز شمارى مى‌كنيم تا مهلتشان سرآيد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بر ضد آنان شتاب مکن، (که) فقط برایشان (روز)شماری بس دقیق می‌کنیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So, do not be hasty with them. We are counting their number (of days).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So do not be impatient for them (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him); We are only completing their number.* (* The number of days left for them or their evil deeds.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So hasten thou not against them; We are only numbering for them a number.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So hasten thou not against them; We are only counting against them a counting. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So make no haste against them; We only count out to them a (limited) number (of the days of the life of this world and delay their term so that they may increase in evil and sins).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So do not hurry against them. We are counting for them a countdown.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Therefore, do not hasten (in seeking a scourge against them). We are counting their days.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So make no haste against them; We only count out to them a (limited) number.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So make no haste against them (O Muhammad). We do but number unto them a sum (of days).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So do not make haste against them; indeed We are counting for them, a counting [down].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Therefore, do not hasten (things) against them, for We count out to them a number,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a [limited] number.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), exercise patience; We have given them respite only for an appointed time.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore be not in haste against them, We only number out to them a number (of days).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fala taAAjal AAalayhim innama naAAuddu lahum AAaddan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So take no hasty action against them; their days are numbered.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So make no haste against them, for We but count out to them a (limited) number (of days).

verses.text: يَوْمَ‌ نَحْشُرُ الْمُتَّقِينَ‌ إِلَى‌ الرَّحْمٰنِ‌ وَفْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [یاد کن] روزی را که پرهیزکاران را به ضیافت و میهمانی [خدای] رحمان گرد می آوریم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: روزى كه پرهيزگاران را نزد خداى رحمان سواره گرد آوريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: روزى كه پرهيزكاران را به مهمانى و ديدار به سوى خداى رحمان فراهم آريم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [ياد كن‌] روزى را كه پرهيزگاران را به سوى [خداى‌] رحمان گروه گروه محشور مى‌كنيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (یاد آور) روزی که متقیان را به سوی خدای مهربان به اجتماع محشور گردانیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: روزی ما پرهیزگاران را (با تعظیم و تکریم هرچه بیشتر) به گونه‌ی گروههائی که به نزد شاهان روند و مهمانان ایشان شوند، در پیشگاه خداوند مهربان جمع می‌نمائیم (و وارد بهشت می‌گردانیم). [[«یَوْمَ»: در روزی. روزی را. مفعول فیه یا مفعول بِهِ است. «نَحْشُرُ»: جمع می‌کنیم. گرد می‌آوریم. «وَفْداً»: گروههای اعزامی به دربار امراء و شاهان. جمع است و مفرد آن (وافد). مانند. رَکْب و راکِب، و صَحْب و صاحِب. حال (الْمُتَّقینَ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: روزی [آید] که پرهیزگاران را چون مهمانان گرامی به نزد خدای رحمان محشور سازیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در آن روز که پرهیزگاران را دسته جمعی بسوی خداوند رحمان (و پاداشهای او) محشور می‌کنیم...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: روزی که گردآوریم پرهیزکاران را بسوی خدای مهربان میهمانانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: روزى كه پرهيزگاران را به سوى خداى رحمان به مهمانى و ديدار فراهم آريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روزی که پرهیزگاران را سوی (خدای) رحمان (به صورت) گروهی جمع می‌کنیم

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The day We shall usher the righteous before Ar-Rahman like envoys into the presence of a king,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: On the day when We shall assemble the righteous towards the Most Gracious, as guests.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: On the day that We shall muster the godfearing to the All-merciful with pomp

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: On the Day whereon We shall gather the God-feaing unto the Com- passionate as an embassy. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The Day We shall gather the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2) unto the Most Beneficent (Allah), like a delegate (presented before a king for honour).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On the Day when We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful, as guests.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The Day shall soon come when We shall bring together the God-fearing to the Most Compassionate Lord, as honoured guests;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The Day We shall gather those with Taqwa unto the Most Gracious (Allah), like a delegation.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On the day when We shall gather the righteous unto the Beneficent, a goodly company.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The day We shall gather the Godwary toward the All-beneficent, on mounts,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and on the Day when We will ceremonially gather the righteous to the Merciful,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the Day of Judgment, when the pious people will be brought into the presence of the Beneficent God as the guests of honor

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The day on which We will gather those who guard (against evil) to the Beneficent Allah to receive honors

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yawma nahshuru almuttaqeena ila alrrahmani wafdan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The Day will surely come when We shall gather the God-fearing like [honoured] guests before the Compassionate God

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The day We shall gather the righteous to (Allah) Most Gracious, like a band presented before a king for honours,

verses.text: وَ نَسُوقُ‌ الْمُجْرِمِينَ‌ إِلَى‌ جَهَنَّمَ‌ وِرْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و مجرمان را تشنه به سوی دوزخ می رانیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و مجرمان را تشنه‌كام به جهنم برانيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و مجرمان را تشنه كام، به سوى دوزخ برانيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و مجرمان را با حال تشنگى به سوى دوزخ مى‌رانيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بدکاران را تشنه لب به سوی آتش دوزخ برانیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و گناهکاران را (همچون شتران تشنه‌ای که به سوی آبشخور به سرعت بروند) تشنه کام به سوی جهنّم می‌رانیم (و بدانجا داخل می‌گردانیم). [[«نَسُوقُ»: می‌رانیم. «وِرْداً»: جمع وارِد، در آیندگان. وارد شوندگان. مجازاً تشنگان، و تشبیهاً چهارپایان تشنه‌کام نیز معنی کرده‌اند که متضمّن تحقیر و توهین بدکاران است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و گناهکاران را به هیئت [رمه‌ای‌] پیاده و تشنه به سوی جهنم برانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و مجرمان را (همچون شتران تشنه‌کامی که به سوی آبگاه می‌روند) به جهنّم می‌رانیم...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برانیم گنهکاران را بسوی دوزخ تشنگانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بزهكاران را تشنه به سوى دوزخ برانيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و مجرمان را با تشنگی سوزان (و) سرگردانی سوی دوزخ می‌رانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And drive the wicked into Hell like cattle driven to water,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And drive the guilty towards hell, thirsty.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and drive the evildoers into Gehenna herding,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And shall drive the culprits to Hell as a herd. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We shall drive the Mujrimun (polytheists, sinners, criminals, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, etc.) to Hell, in a thirsty state (like a thirsty herd driven down to water),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And herd the sinners into hell, like animals to water.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We shall drive the guilty ones to Hell as a thirsty herd.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We shall drive the criminals to Hell, in a thirsty state.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And drive the guilty unto hell, a weary herd,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and drive the guilty as a thirsty herd towards hell,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and drive the evildoers as herds, into Gehenna

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and the criminals will be driven and thrown into hell,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We will drive the guilty to hell thirsty

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanasooqu almujrimeena ila jahannama wirdan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and We shall drive the sinful like a thirsty herd into Hell.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We shall drive the sinners to Hell, like thirsty cattle driven down to water,-

verses.text: لاَ يَمْلِکُونَ‌ الشَّفَاعَةَ إِلاَّ مَنِ‌ اتَّخَذَ عِنْدَ الرَّحْمٰنِ‌ عَهْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [شفیعان در آن روز] قدرت بر شفاعت ندارند مگر کسانی [مانند پیامبران، امامان، فرشتگان و اولیا] که از نزد [خدای] رحمان، پیمانی [بر اذن شفاعت] گرفته باشند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از شفاعت بى‌نصيبند، مگر آن كس كه با خداى رحمان پيمانى بسته باشد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آنها مالك شفاعت نيستند، جز آن كس كه نزد خداى رحمان پيمانى گرفته باشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [آنان‌] اختيار شفاعت را ندارند، جز آن كس كه از جانب [خداى‌] رحمان پيمانى گرفته است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آن روز هیچ کس مالک شفاعت نباشد مگر کسی که (به پرستش حق) از خدای مهربان عهدنامه (توحید کامل و شفاعت) دریافته است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (در آن روز، چه بندگان متّقی و چه بندگان مجرم مؤمن و غیر مؤمن، هیچ یک از) آنان نمی‌توانند شفاعت بکنند، مگر آن کسی که با خداوند مهربان عهد و پیمان دارد (که یکتاپرستی و انجام کارهای شایسته در دنیا است). [[«لا یَمْلِکُونَ»: نمی‌توانند. دارا نیستند. مراد بندگان خدا به طور کلّی است. «إِلاّ مَنْ»: مراد کسانی است که یکتاپرست و مؤمنِ راستین باشند. چنین کسانی بعد از اجازه خداوند مهربان می‌توانند شفاعت بکنند (نگا: طه / 109، سبأ / 23، زخرف / 86، نجم / 26). «عَهْداً»: پیمان. مراد توحید و ایمان خالص است. برخی پیمان را (اذن) مذکور در آیات متعدّد قرآن دانسته‌اند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از شفاعت برخوردار نیستند، مگر کسی که [با ایمان و توحید] از خدای رحمان پیمانی گرفته باشد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنان هرگز مالک شفاعت نیستند؛ مگر کسی که نزد خداوند رحمان، عهد و پیمانی دارد.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: دارای شفاعت نیستند جز آنکو بگرفته است نزد خداوند مهربان پیمانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: توان شفاعت ندارند مگر آن كه از نزد خداى رحمان پيمانى گرفته باشد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آنان دارای شفاعت نیستند، جز آن کس که نزد (خدای) رحمان پیمانی برگرفته است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: None will have power to intercede for them except one who obtains a promise from Ar-Rahman.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: People do not own the right to intercede, except those* who have made a covenant with the Most Gracious. (* The Holy Prophets and virtuous people will be given the permission to intercede. Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him – will be the first to intercede.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: having no power of intercession, save those who have taken with the All-merciful covenant.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They shall not own intercession, excepting those who have taken of the Compassionate a covenant. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from the Most Beneficent (Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will have no power of intercession, except for someone who has an agreement with the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On that Day none will have the power to intercede for them except those who received a sanction from the Most Compassionate Lord.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from the Most Gracious (Allah).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They will have no power of intercession, save him who hath made a covenant with his Lord.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: no one will have the power to intercede [with Allah], except for him who has taken a covenant with the All-beneficent.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: who have no power of intercession, except those who have taken a covenant with the Merciful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: no one will be able to intercede for the others except those whom the Beneficent God has given authority.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They shall not control intercession, save he who has made a covenant with the Beneficent Allah.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yamlikoona alshshafaAAata illa mani ittakhatha AAinda alrrahmani AAahdan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: No one will have power to intercede, except for those who have permission from the Lord of Mercy.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.

verses.text: وَ قَالُوا اتَّخَذَ الرَّحْمٰنُ‌ وَلَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [مشرکان] گفتند: [خدای] رحمان برای خود فرزندی گرفته است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: خداى رحمان صاحب فرزندى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و گفتند: خداى رحمان فرزندى گرفته است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و گفتند: «[خداى‌] رحمان فرزندى اختيار كرده است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و کافران گفتند که خدای رحمان فرزند برگرفته!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (یهودیان و مسیحیان و مشرکان) می‌گویند: خداوند مهربان فرزندی برای خود برگرفته است! [[«قالُوا»: مراد مسیحیان و یهودیان (نگا: توبه / 30) و مشرکان قریش است (نگا: زخرف / 19).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ادعا کردند که خدای رحمان فرزندی برگزیده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و گفتند: «خداوند رحمان فرزندی برای خود برگزیده است».

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفتند برگرفت خدا فرزندی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و گفتند: خداى رحمان فرزندى گرفت

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گفتند: « (خدای) رحمان فرزندی بر گرفته.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They say: "God has begotten a son."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And the disbelievers said, “The Most Gracious has chosen an offspring.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And they say, 'The All-merciful has taken unto Himself a son.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they say: the Compassionate hath taken a son. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they say: "The Most Beneficent (Allah) has begotten a son (or offspring or children) [as the Jews say: 'Uzair (Ezra) is the son of Allah, and the Christians say that He has begotten a son ['Iesa (Christ)], and the pagan Arabs say that He has begotten daughters (angels, etc.)]."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they say, “The Most Merciful has begotten a son.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They claim: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken a son to Himself."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they say: "The Most Gracious (Allah) has begotten a son."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they say: The Beneficent hath taken unto Himself a son.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They say, ‘The All-beneficent has taken a son!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And they say: 'The Merciful has taken a son'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They have said that the Beneficent God has given birth to a son.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they say: The Beneficent Allah has taken (to Himself) a son.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqaloo ittakhatha alrrahmanu waladan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They say, "The Gracious One has begotten a son."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"

verses.text: لَقَدْ جِئْتُمْ‌ شَيْئاً إِدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به راستی که چیزی بسیار زشت و نسبتی بس ناروا [به میان] آورده اید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه سخنى زشت آورده‌ايد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: واقعا چيز زشتى بر زبان آورديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: واقعاً چيز زشتى را [بر زبان‌] آورديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای کافران) همانا شما سخنی بسیار زشت و منکر بر زبان آوردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: واقعاً چیز بسیار زشت و زننده‌ای را می‌گوئید. [[«إِدّاً»: بسیار زشت و زننده. سخت شگفت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به راستی که ادعای شگرفی پیش آوردید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: راستی مطلب زشت و زننده‌ای گفتید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا آوردید چیزی گران را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه چيزى سخت زشت و ناپسند آورده‌ايد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان چیز زشتی را همانا (بر زبان) آوردید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You have uttered a grievous thing

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: You have indeed brought an extremely grave speech!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: You have indeed advanced something hideous!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Assuredly ye have brought a thing monstrous. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Indeed you have brought forth (said) a terrible evil thing.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You have come up with something monstrous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely you have made a monstrous statement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Indeed you have brought forth (said) a thing Idda.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Assuredly ye utter a disastrous thing

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: You have certainly advanced something hideous!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, you have brought a monstrous thing!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: You have done an atrocious thing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This is certainly a monstrous lie!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Certainly you have made an abominable assertion

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laqad jitum shayan iddan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Assuredly, you have uttered a monstrous falsehood:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous!

verses.text: تَکَادُ السَّمَاوَاتُ‌ يَتَفَطَّرْنَ‌ مِنْهُ‌ وَ تَنْشَقُ‌ الْأَرْضُ‌ وَ تَخِرُّ الْجِبَالُ‌ هَدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: نزدیک است آسمان ها از این [ادعای بی اصل و سخن ناروا] پاره پاره شوند، و زمین بشکافد، و کوه ها به شدت در هم بشکنند و فرو ریزند!!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نزديك است كه از اين سخن آسمانها بشكافند و زمين شكافته شود و كوه‌ها فروافتند و در هم ريزند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: نزديك است آسمان‌ها از اين سخن بشكافند و زمين چاك خورد و كوه‌ها فرو ريخته درهم بشكنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چيزى نمانده است كه آسمانها از اين [سخن‌] بشكافند و زمين چاك خورد و كوهها به شدت فرو ريزند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: نزدیک است از این گفته زشت و عقیده باطل آسمانها از هم فرو ریزد و زمین بشکافد و کوهها متلاشی گردد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نزدیک است آسمانها به خاطر این سخن از هم متلاشی گردد، و زمین بشکافد، و کوهها به شدّت درهم فرو ریزد! [[«تَکَادُ»: نزدیک است. «یَتَفَطَّرْنَ»: شق شوند. متلاشی گردند. «تَخِرُّ»: فرو افتند. فرو ریزند. «هَدّاً»: به شدّت ویران کردن و اجزاء پیکره را پراکنده نمودن. مفعول مطلق تأکیدی (تَخِرُّ) است. یا این که به معنی متفرّق و پراکنده است، که در این صورت (هَدّاً) به معنی (مَهْدُودَةً) و حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: نزدیک است که آسمانها از [ناروایی‌] آن پاره پاره شود و زمین بشکافد و کوهها فرو ریزند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: نزدیک است به خاطر این سخن آسمانها از هم متلاشی گردد، و زمین شکافته شود، و کوه‌ها بشدّت فرو ریزد...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که نزدیک است آسمانها پاشیده شوند از آن و از هم بشکافد زمین و بیفتد کوه‌ها فروریخته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نزديك است كه آسمانها از اين سخن بشكافند و زمين شكافته شود و كوه‌ها در هم شكسته فرو ريزند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: نزدیک است آسمان‌ها از آن (سخن) بی‌مهابا بشکافند، و زمین چاک خورَد و کوه‌ها به سختی با صدایی جانکاه فرو ریزند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Which would cleave the skies asunder, rend the earth, and split the mountains,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The heavens are close to being torn apart by it, and the earth being split asunder, and the mountains succumbing and falling down.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The heavens are wellnigh rent of it and the earth split asunder, and the mountains wellnigh fall down crashing for

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Well-nigh the heavens are rent thereat and the earth cleft in sunder and the mountains fall down in pieces. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Whereby the heavens are almost torn, and the earth is split asunder, and the mountains fall in ruins,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: At which the heavens almost rupture, and the earth splits, and the mountains fall and crumble.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is such a monstrosity that heavens might well-nigh burst forth at it, the earth might be cleaved, and the mountains fall

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Whereby the heavens are almost torn, and the earth is split asunder, and the mountains Hadda.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Whereby almost the heavens are torn, and the earth is split asunder and the mountains fall in ruins,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The heavens are about to be rent apart at it, the earth to split open, and the mountains to collapse into bits,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Thereby the heavens are nearly torn and the earth split asunder, and mountains fall crashing down

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This would almost cause the heavens to rent apart, the earth to cleave asunder and the mountains to crumble down in fragments,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The heavens may almost be rent thereat, and the earth cleave asunder, and the mountains fall down in pieces,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Takadu alssamawatu yatafattarna minhu watanshaqqu alardu watakhirru aljibalu haddan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: the heavens might well-nigh burst thereat, and the earth break asunder, and the mountains fall down in pieces,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,

verses.text: أَنْ‌ دَعَوْا لِلرَّحْمٰنِ‌ وَلَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به خاطر آنکه برای [خدای] رحمان فرزندی ادعا کرده اند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: زيرا براى خداى رحمان فرزندى قائل شده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه براى خداى رحمان فرزند قايل شدند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: از اينكه براى [خداى‌] رحمان فرزندى قايل شدند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چرا که برای خدای مهربان فرزندی (مسیح و عزیر و ملایک را) دعوی کردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از این که به خداوند مهربان، فرزندی نسبت می‌دهند. [[«دَعَوْا»: نسبت دادند. ادّعاء کردند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از اینکه برای خدای رحمان فرزندی قائل شدند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از این رو که برای خداوند رحمان فرزندی قائل شدند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چرا که خواندند برای خدای مهربان فرزندی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه براى خداى رحمان فرزندى خواندند- فرشتگان را فرزند خدا خواندند-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (از) اینکه برای (خدای) رحمان فرزندی (را) خواندند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For they have attributed a son to Ar-Rahman,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Due to their ascribing of an offspring to the Most Gracious.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: that they have attributed to the All-merciful a son;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That they should ascribe unto the Compassionate a son. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That they ascribe a son (or offspring or children) to the Most Beneficent (Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Because they attribute a son to the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: at their ascribing a son to the Most Compassionate Lord.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: That they ascribe a son to the Most Gracious.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That ye ascribe unto the Beneficent a son,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: that they should ascribe a son to the All-beneficent!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: because they have ascribed a son to the Merciful.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: to ascribe a son to the Beneficent God.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: That they ascribe a son to the Beneficent Allah.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: An daAAaw lilrrahmani waladan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: because they ascribe a son to the Gracious One.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That they should invoke a son for (Allah) Most Gracious.

verses.text: وَ مَا يَنْبَغِي‌ لِلرَّحْمٰنِ‌ أَنْ‌ يَتَّخِذَ وَلَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [خدای] رحمان را نسزد که فرزندی اختیار کند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خداى رحمان را سزاوار نيست كه صاحب فرزندى باشد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و حال آن كه خداى رحمان را نشايد كه فرزند گيرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [خداى‌] رحمان را نسزد كه فرزندى اختيار كند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در صورتی که هرگز خدای رحمن را (که منزه از مثل و مانند است) فرزند داشتن سزاوار نخواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: برای خداوند مهربان سزاوار نیست که فرزندی برگیرد. [[«ما یَنبَغی»: سزاوار نیست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سزاوار نیست که خداوند رحمان فرزندی برگزیند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در حالی که هرگز برای خداوند رحمان سزاوار نیست که فرزندی برگزیند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیست شایسته برای خداوند مهربان که گیرد فرزندی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خداى رحمان را نسزد كه فرزندى گيرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (خدای) رحمان را هرگز نسزد که فرزندی برگیرد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When it does not behove the Merciful to have a son.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it does not befit the Most Gracious to choose an offspring!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and it behoves not the All-merciful to take a son.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And it behoveth not the Compassionate that he should take a son. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But it is not suitable for (the Majesty of) the Most Beneficent (Allah) that He should beget a son (or offspring or children).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is not fitting for the Most Merciful to have a son.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It does not befit the Most Compassionate Lord that He should take a son.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But it is not suitable for the Most Gracious that He should beget a son.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When it is not meet for (the Majesty of) the Beneficent that He should choose a son.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It does not behoove the All-beneficent to take a son.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It is not for the Merciful to take a son!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Beneficent God is too Exalted to have a son.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And it is not worthy of the Beneficent Allah that He should take (to Himself) a son.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama yanbaghee lilrrahmani an yattakhitha waladan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It does not become the majesty of the Compassionate God to take to Himself a son:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious that He should beget a son.

verses.text: إِنْ‌ کُلُ‌ مَنْ‌ فِي‌ السَّمَاوَاتِ‌ وَ الْأَرْضِ‌ إِلاَّ آتِي‌ الرَّحْمٰنِ‌ عَبْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هیچ کس در آسمان ها و زمین نیست مگر اینکه [ذاتاً] بنده [و مملوک] به سوی [خدای] رحمان می آید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هيچ چيز در آسمانها و زمين نيست مگر آنكه به بندگى سوى خداى رحمان بيايد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در آسمان‌ها و زمين هيچ كسى نيست مگر آن كه بنده‌وار نزد خداى رحمان مى‌آيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: هر كه در آسمانها و زمين است جز بنده‌وار به سوى [خداى‌] رحمان نمى‌آيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه هیچ موجودی در آسمانها و زمین نیست جز اینکه خدا را بنده فرمانبردار است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تمام کسانی که در آسمانها و زمین هستند، بنده‌ی خداوند مهربان (و فرمانبردار یزدان) می‌باشند. [[«إِنْ»: نیست. حرف نفی است. «مَنْ»: کسانی که. «آتِی»: آینده. مراد فرمانبردار است. یعنی مقصود (إِتْیانِ) معنوی به معنی خضوع و خشوع در برابر فرمان است. «عَبْداً»: بنده گوش به فرمان و مطیع. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: جز این نیست که هر موجودی که در آسمانها و زمین است، بنده‌وار سر به درگاه خدای رحمان فرود می‌آورد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تمام کسانی که در آسمانها و زمین هستند، بنده اویند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نیست هر کدام از آنان که در آسمانها و زمینند جز آینده است خداوند مهربان را بنده‌ای‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در آسمانها و زمين هيچ كس نيست مگر آنكه خداى رحمان را بنده‌وار آيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هیچ کس در آسمان‌ها و زمین نیست جز اینکه در حالت بندگی نزد (خدای) رحمان آینده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: There is no one in the heavens and the earth but comes before Ar-Rahman in all obedience.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: All those who are in the heavens and the earth will come to the Most Gracious as His bondmen.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: None is there in the heavens and earth but he comes to the All-merciful as a servant;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: None there is in the heavens and the earth but must come unto the Compassionate as a bondman. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: There is none in the heavens and the earth but comes unto the Most Beneficent (Allah) as a slave.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: There is none in the heavens and the earth but will come to the Most Merciful as a servant.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: There is no one in the heavens and the earth but he shall come to the Most Compassionate Lord as His servant.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: There is none in the heavens and the earth but comes unto the Most Gracious as a slave.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: There is none in the heavens and the earth but cometh unto the Beneficent as a slave.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There is none in the heavens and the earth but he comes to the All-beneficent as a servant.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: There is none in the heavens and earth except he comes to the Merciful as a worshiper.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: All that is in the heavens and the earth will return to the Beneficent God as His submissive servants.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: There is no one in the heavens and the earth but will come to the Beneficent Allah as a servant.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: In kullu man fee alssamawati waalardi illa atee alrrahmani AAabdan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: there is none in the heavens or on the earth but shall return to the Merciful in utter submission,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come to (Allah) Most Gracious as a servant.

verses.text: لَقَدْ أَحْصَاهُمْ‌ وَ عَدَّهُمْ‌ عَدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به یقین همه آنان را [با قدرت و دانشش کنترل و] احاطه نموده و درست و دقیق شماره کرده است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او همه را حساب كرده و يك‌يك شمرده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌شك همه آنها را بر شمرده و كامل شمرده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و يقيناً آنها را به حساب آورده و به دقت شماره كرده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: محقّقا او به شماره همه موجودات کاملا آگاه است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او همه‌ی آنان را سرشماری کرده است، و دقیقاً تعدادشان را می‌داند. [[«أَحْصَاهُمْ»: ایشان را سرشماری کرده است. شماره ایشان را داشته است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به راستی همه را شماره کرده و حساب همگیشان را داریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: خداوند همه آنها را احصا کرده، و به دقّت شمرده است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا فراگرفتشان و بشمردشان شمردنی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه آنان را در شمار آورده و همه را درست برشمرده است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همواره بی‌گمان آنان را اِحاطه و شماره‌ای ممتاز کرده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He has counted them and calculated their number.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He knows their number and has counted each one of them.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He has indeed counted them, and He has numbered them exactly.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Assuredly He hath comprehanded them and counted them a full Counting. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, He knows each one of them, and has counted them a full counting.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He has enumerated them, and counted them one by one.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily He encompasses them and has counted them all.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, He knows each one of them, and has counted them a full counting.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Verily He knoweth them and numbereth them with (right) numbering.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly He has counted them [all] and numbered them precisely,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He has counted them and exactly numbered all;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He has counted and enumerated them one by one.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Certainly He has a comprehensive knowledge of them and He has numbered them a (comprehensive) numbering.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laqad ahsahum waAAaddahum AAaddan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He has counted them and numbered them precisely,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He does take an account of them (all), and hath numbered them (all) exactly.

verses.text: وَ کُلُّهُمْ‌ آتِيهِ‌ يَوْمَ‌ الْقِيَامَةِ فَرْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و روز قیامت همه آنان تنها به پیشگاه او می آیند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و همگيشان در روز قيامت تنها نزد او مى‌آيند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و روز قيامت همه آنها به نزد او تنها خواهند آمد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و روز قيامت همه آنها تنها، به سوى او خواهند آمد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و تمام آنها روز قیامت منفرد و تنها به پیشگاه حضرتش حضور می‌یابند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و همه‌ی آنان روز رستاخیز تک و تنها (بدون یار و یاور و اموال و اولاد و محافظ و مراقب) در محضر او حاضر می‌شوند. [[«فَرْداً»: تک و تنها. از همه چیز بریده و به پیش خدا رسیده. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و همگیشان روز قیامت یکه و تنها به نزد او آیند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و همگی روز رستاخیز، تک و تنها نزد او حاضر می‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همگیشان آینده‌اند او را روز قیامت تنها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همه آنها روز رستاخيز تنها [و تهيدست‌] نزد او آيند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و روز قیامت همه‌ی آنها تنها، سوی او آینده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Every one of them will come before Him all alone on the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And each one of them will come before Him on the Day of Resurrection, alone.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Every one of them shall come to Him upon the Day of Resurrection, all alone.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And each of them is to come to Him on the Day of Judgment alone. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And everyone of them will come to Him alone on the Day of Resurrection (without any helper, or protector or defender).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And each one of them will come to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On the Day of Resurrection each one of these will come to Him singly.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And everyone of them will come to Him alone on the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And each one of them will come unto Him on the Day of Resurrection, alone.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and each of them will come to Him alone on the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and each one shall come to Him on the Day of Resurrection, alone.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Everyone on the Day of Judgment will individually come into the presence of God.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And every one of them will come to Him on the day of resurrection alone.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wakulluhum ateehi yawma alqiyamati fardan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: each one of them shall come to Him one by one on the Day of Judgement.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And everyone of them will come to Him singly on the Day of Judgment.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ آمَنُوا وَ عَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ‌ سَيَجْعَلُ‌ لَهُمُ‌ الرَّحْمٰنُ‌ وُدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: قطعاً کسانی که ایمان آورده و کارهای شایسته انجام داده اند، به زودی [خدای] رحمان برای آنان [در دل ها] محبتی قرار خواهد داد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خداى رحمان كسانى را كه ايمان آورده‌اند و كارهاى شايسته كرده‌اند، محبوب همه گرداند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كسانى كه ايمان آورده و كارهاى شايسته كرده‌اند، به زودى خداى رحمان براى آنها محبتى [در دل‌ها] قرار خواهد داد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كسانى كه ايمان آورده و كارهاى شايسته كرده‌اند، به زودى [خداى‌] رحمان براى آنان محبتى [در دلها] قرار مى‌دهد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا آنان که به خدا ایمان آوردند و نیکوکار شدند خدای رحمان آنها را (در نظر خلق و حق) محبوب می‌گرداند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بی‌گمان کسانی که ایمان می‌آورند و کارهای شایسته و پسندیده انجام می‌دهند، خداوند مهربان آنان را دوست می‌دارد و حجّت ایشان را به دلها می‌افکند. [[«سَیَجْعَلُ لَهُمْ وُدّاً»: ایشان را دوست می‌دارد. آنان را در نظر مردم عزیز، و محبّت آنان را به دلها می‌اندازد (نگا: حشر / 9 و 10).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: کسانی که ایمان آورده و کارهای شایسته کرده‌اند، زودا که خداوند رحمان در حق آنان مهربانی کند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مسلّماً کسانی که ایمان آورده و کارهای شایسته انجام داده‌اند، خداوند رحمان محبّتی برای آنان در دلها قرار می‌دهد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا آنان که ایمان آوردند و عمل صالح کردند زود است بنهد برای ایشان خداوند مهربان دوستی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كسانى كه ايمان آوردند و كارهاى نيك و شايسته كردند خداى رحمان براى آنان دوستيى [در دلها] خواهد نهاد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان کسانی که ایمان آورده و عمل شایسته(ی ایمان) کرده‌اند، (خدای) رحمان به زودی برایشان دوستی‌ای خواهد نهاد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Surely Ar-Rahman will show love for those who believe and do the right.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed those who believed and did good deeds – the Most Gracious will appoint love for them. (In the hearts of other believers.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely those who believe and do deeds of righteousness -- unto them the All-merciful shall assign love.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily those who believe and do righteOUs works--anon the Compassionate shall appoint for them affection. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, those who believe [in the Oneness of Allah and in His Messenger (Muhammad SAW)] and work deeds of righteousness, the Most Beneficent (Allah) will bestow love for them (in the hearts of the believers).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those who believe and do righteous deeds, the Most Merciful will give them love.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Indeed, the Most Compassionate Lord will soon create enduring love for those who believe and do righteous works.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, the Most Gracious will bestow love for them.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! those who believe and do good works, the Beneficent will appoint for them love.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed those who have faith and do righteous deeds—the All-beneficent will endear them [to His creation].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Those who believe and do righteous deeds, the Merciful will assign for them love.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: To the righteously striving believers God will grant love.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely (as for) those who believe and do good deeds for them will Allah bring about love.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna allatheena amanoo waAAamiloo alssalihati sayajAAalu lahumu alrrahmanu wuddan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The Lord of Mercy will bestow affection upon those who believe and perform righteous deeds.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, will (Allah) Most Gracious bestow love.

verses.text: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَاهُ‌ بِلِسَانِکَ‌ لِتُبَشِّرَ بِهِ‌ الْمُتَّقِينَ‌ وَ تُنْذِرَ بِهِ‌ قَوْماً لُدّاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: جز این نیست که ما این [قرآن] را بر زبان تو آسان ساختیم تا به وسیله آن پرهیزکاران را مژده دهی و مردم ستیزه جو را بترسانی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اين قرآن را بر زبان تو آسان كرديم تا پرهيزگاران را مژده دهى و ستيزه‌گران را بترسانى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: جز اين نيست كه ما اين [قرآن‌] را به زبان تو آسان ساختيم تا پرهيزكاران را بدان مژده دهى و ستيزه گران را بدان بترسانى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، ما اين [قرآن‌] را بر زبان تو آسان ساختيم تا پرهيزگاران را بدان نويد، و مردم ستيزه‌جو را بدان بيم دهى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما حقایق این قرآن را بی‌تردید به زبان تو سهل و آسان کردیم تا به آن اهل تقوا را بشارت دهی و معاندان لجوج را بترسانی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما قرآن را به زبان تو (که عربی است) ساده و آسان فراهم آورده‌ایم، تا به وسیله‌ی آن، پرهیزگاران را (به رضا و نعمت خدای مهربان) مژده دهی، و مردمان سرسخت (دشمن حق و طرفدار باطل) را با آن (از ناخوشنودی و عذاب یزدان) بترسانی. [[«یَسَّرْنَاهُ»: قرآن را سهل و ساده کرده‌ایم. قرآن را آسان و روان فراهم آورده‌ایم (نگا: قمر / 17 و 22 و 32 و 40). «بِلِسَانِکَ»: به زبان تو که عربی فصیح و روشن و گویا است (نگا: نحل / 103، یوسف / 2). «لُدّاً»: جمع أَلَدّ، دشمنان سرسختی که به باطل بر عداوت لجاجت دارند (نگا: بقره / 204).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همانا آن [قرآن‌] را به زبان تو آسان بیان کردیم تا پرهیزگاران را به آن بشارت دهی و مردم ستیزه‌جو را به آن بیم دهی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما فقط آن [= قرآن‌] را بر زبان تو آسان ساختیم تا پرهیزگاران را بوسیله آن بشارت دهی، و دشمنان سرسخت را با آنان انذار کنی.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز این نیست که روانش گردانیدیم بر زبان تو تا بشارت دهی بدان پرهیزکاران را و بترسانی بدان قومی سرسخت را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا [خواندن‌] اين

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس تنها ما این قرآن را به زبان تو آسان(فهم) کردیم، تا پرهیزگاران را نوید، و گروهی سخت‌دل را هشدار دهی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So We have made this (Qur'an) easy in your tongue that you may give good news to those who take heed, and warn the people who are contentious.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We have therefore made this Qur’an easy upon your tongue, (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) for you to announce glad tidings with it to those who fear, and warn those who are quarrelsome.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Now We have made it easy by thy tongue that thou mayest bear good tidings thereby to the godfearing, and warn a people stubborn.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So We have made it easy in thine tongue in order that thou mayest thereby give glad tidings unto the Godfearing and warn thereby a people contentious. *Chapter: 19

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So We have made this (the Quran) easy in your own tongue (O Muhammad SAW), only that you may give glad tidings to the Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - See V. 2:2), and warn with it the Ludda (most quarrelsome) people.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We made it easy in your tongue, in order to deliver good news to the righteous, and to warn with it a hostile people.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Therefore, We have revealed the Qur'an in your tongue and made it easy to understand that you may give glad tidings to the God-fearing and warn a contentious people.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, We have made this easy in your own tongue, only that you may give glad tidings to those who have Taqwa, and warn with it the people that are Ludda.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We make (this Scripture) easy in thy tongue, (O Muhammad) only that thou mayst bear good tidings therewith unto those who ward off (evil), and warn therewith the froward folk.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed We have made it simple in your language so that you may give good news thereby to the Godwary and warn with it a disputatious lot.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have made it easy in your own tongue in order that you proclaim the glad tidings to the cautious and give warning to a stubborn nation.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), We have given you the Book (the Quran) in your own language so that you could easily give the glad news to the pious ones and warn the quarrelsome ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
